city shall have and may exercise all powers relating to airports and aviation granted by this charter and general law including all powers to act jointly with other governmental authorities in relation thereto the council may by ordinance provide for a department of aviation with such duties functions and powers as may be provided thereby general provisions amending the charter this charter may be amended at anytime in the manner provided by of the constitution of the state of colorado continuance of duties all persons holding administrative office by appointment and members of administrative boards at the time this charter takes effect shall continue in office and in the performance of their duties until provision shall have been made in accordance with this charter for the performance of such duties or the discontinuance of such office outgoing officers all officers of the city whose terms of office terminate shall deliver to their successors all papers records property and equipment whatsoever in their possession or custody by virtue of their office and shall account to them or to any authority designated by the council for all funds credits or property of any kind with which they are properly chargeable as such officials eminent domain all proceedings for the condemnation of property or in the exercise of the right of eminent domain shall be in accordance with the laws of the state of colorado now or hereafter applicable construction of charter if any provision section article or clause of this charter or the application thereof to any person or circumstances shall be found to be invalid by a court such invalidity shall not affect any remaining portion or applications of the charter provided such remaining portions or applications are not determined by the court to be inoperable and to this end this charter is declared to be severable construction of words whenever such construction is applicable words used in this charter importing singular or plural number maybe construed so that one number includes both  words importing masculine gender may be construed to apply to the feminine gender as well  and the word person may extend to and include firm and corporation  provided that these rules of construction shall not apply to any part of this charter containing express provisions excluding such construction or where the subject matter or context is repugnant thereto chapter 1  general provisions how cited the ordinances embraced in this and the following chapters and sections shall constitute and be designated the the city of cortez colorado and may be so cited such ordinances may also be cited as cortez city  for charter provision requiring codification see char art iii  12 for state law as to authority of city to adopt reference see crs 197  3112401 et seq definitions and rules of construction in the construction of this of all ordinances and regulations of the city the following definitions and rules of construction shall be observed unless it shall be otherwise expressly provided in any section ordinance or regulation or unless inconsistent with the manifest intent of the city council or unless the context clearly requires otherwise city the words the city or this city shall mean the city of cortez colorado city council the words city council or the council shall mean the city council of cortez colorado computation of time the time within which an act is to be done shall be computed by excluding the first and including the last day  and if the last day is sunday or a legal holiday that shall be excluded county the words the county shall mean the county of montezuma colorado day a day is the period of time between any midnight and the midnight following  daytime nighttime daytime is the period of time between sunrise and sunset nighttime is the period of time between sunset and sunrise gender any word importing the masculine gender only shall also include and mean the feminine and neuter in the city the words in the city shall mean and include all territory over which the city now has or shall hereafter acquire the jurisdiction for the exercise of its police powers or other regulatory powers joint authority all words giving a joint authority to three or more persons shall be construed as giving such authority to a majority of such persons may shall the word may is permissive the word shall is mandatory month the word month shall mean a calendar month number any word importing the singular number only shall also include and mean the plural oath the word oath shall be construed to include an affirmation in all cases in which by law an affirmation may be substituted for an oath and in such cases the words swear and sworn shall be equivalent to the words affirm and affirmed officers departments etc officers departments boards commissions and employees referred to in this mean officers departments boards commissions and employees of the city of cortez unless the context clearly indicates otherwise owner the word owner applied to a building or land shall include any part owner joint owner tenant in common joint or tenant by the entirety of the whole or a part of such building or land person the word person shall mean and include firm association club or other organized group partnership corporation and governmental agency as well as a natural person preceding  following the words preceding and following shall mean next before and next after respectively property the word property shall include real tangible and intangible personal property real property the terms real property premises real estate or lands shall be deemed to be coextensive with lands tenements and hereditaments sidewalk the word sidewalk shall mean the portion of the street between the curbline and the adjacent property line intended for the use of pedestrians signature where the written signature of any person is required the proper handwriting of such person or his mark shall be intended state the words the state or this state shall mean the state of colorado street the word street shall mean and include any public way highway street avenue boulevard parkway alley or other public thoroughfare and each of such words shall include all of them tenant the word tenant or occupant applied to a building or land shall include any person who occupies the whole or a part of such building or land whether alone or with others writing the words writing and written shall include printing lithographing or any other mode of representing words and letters whenever any and empowered to designate polling places within the voting precincts by public announcement thereof in any call for election as provided by law  council rules of procedure generally the following shall be the rules of procedure of the city council a suspension of rules the rules of procedure and order of business shall be strictly adhered to by the council unless temporarily suspended by a twothirds vote of the members present b dates of regular meetings the council shall meet regularly on the second and fourth tuesday of every month at the city hall c calling of special meetingsgenerally the mayor or any four members of the council may call special meetings of the council but no such call shall be made unless at least twentyfour hours notice of the time of such meeting have been given to each and every member of the council as provided by this section that special meetings may be called and held upon shorter notice if five members of the council personally accept such call d samenotice notice of special meetings shall be in writing shall be served by the chief of police other policemen or by any other person of lawful age and shall be served on each councilman personally or by leaving a copy of such notice at his usual place of business or residence e presiding officer the mayor or in his absence the mayor pro tempore shall call the meetings of the council to order and preside at all meetings in case of the absence of the mayor and the mayor pro tempore the city clerk shall call the meeting to order and if a quorum is present one of the councilmen may be elected to preside at the meeting f quorum at all meetings of the council four councilmen shall constitute a quorum for the transaction of business but a minority may adjourn from day to day until a quorum is in attendance g call to order  roll call  order of business at the hour appointed for the meeting the members of the council shall be called to order by the presiding officer the city clerk shall then call the roll and note those present and those absent after which the presiding officer shall announce whether a quorum is present if a quorum is present the council shall proceed to do business the council by motion or resolution may adopt an order of business from time to time h questions of priority of business all questions relating to the priority of business shall be decided without debate i conduct of members previous to speaking every member shall address the presiding officer and shall not proceed with his remarks until recognized by him no member shall leave the council chamber while the council is in session except by the permission of the presiding officer any member called to order shall immediately suspend his remarks and resume his seat unless permitted to continue any member failing or refusing to vote on any question shall be deemed to have voted in the affirmative unless excused from voting by the council on matters involving the consideration of his own official conduct or where his financial interests are involved j reduction of motions or resolutions to writing  consideration of motions all motions and resolutions shall be reduced to writing if required by any member of the council and when seconded and stated by the presiding officer or read by the clerk shall be open for consideration k taking and recording of vote the vote on all ordinances resolutions and motions shall be taken by ayes and nays and shall be entered in the journal l motions to adjourn a motion to adjourn shall always be in order shall have precedence over all other motions and shall be decided without debate m appointment of committees all committees shall be appointed by the presiding officer unless otherwise ordered by the council n preservation of order the presiding officer shall preserve order and decorum and shall decide all questions of order subject to the right of appeal to the council o appeal of decisions of presiding officer appeals shall be allowed from all decisions of the presiding officer to the council and a majority vote of all the members present shall be required to sustain such an appeal p standing committees generally the standing committees if any shall be appointed annually at the first regular meeting after the election of officers and the person first named to the committee shall be the chairman thereof in the absence of such chairman or other inability to act the second person named to the committee shall act as chairman thereof standing and special committees may be created by motion or resolution of the council q conduct of executive sessions when the council is in executive session the room shall be cleared of all persons except the councilmen the city manager the city attorney and the city clerk  provided that the council may authorize other designated persons to remain all matters discussed in executive session shall be kept secret unless the council provides otherwise r records of proceedings the council shall cause a record of the proceedings to be kept which shall be open at all reasonable hours for the inspection of the electors of the city s applicability of roberts rules except as provided by the charter or these rules roberts rules of order revised shall govern the proceedings of the council insofar as it is applicable t enforcement  penalty the council shall make and enforce the rules of procedure and may compel their observance by a fine not exceeding five dollars u amendment these rules may be amended at any time by ordinance v cancellation of a municipal election it is ordained by the city council of the city of cortez colorado that 1 no writein vote for any municipal office shall be counted unless an affidavit of intent has been filed with the city clerk by the person whose name is written in prior to twenty days before the day of the election such affidavit shall contain a that the person desires the office  and b is qualified to assume the duties of the office if elected 2 election may be cancelled when a a municipal election may be cancelled if the only matter before the voters is election of persons to office and if at the close of business on the nineteenth day before the election there are not more candidates than offices to be filled at such election including candidates filing affidavits of intent 3 the clerk if instructed by resolution of the governing body either before or after such date shall cancel the election and by resolution declare the candidates elected upon such declaration by resolution the candidates shall be deemed elected 4 notice of such cancellation shall be published if possible in order to inform electors of the municipality and notice of such cancellation shall be posted at each polling place and not less than one other public place 5 if one of the terms for which the candidates are declared elected is a twoyear term as opposed to a fouryear term then the one twoyear term shall be decided amongst the candidates if the candidates cannot decide who shall have the twoyear term it shall be decided by lot    for charter provision as to council generally see char art iii for state law as to council generally see crs 197  315105 315106 315108 a  qualifications for appointment for members of boards and commissioners a in addition to the qualifications stated in any cortez charter provision cortez ordinance code provision or resolution regarding appointment of the members of any city of cortez board or commission all prospective board members shall undergo a criminal background check b prospective members shall be disqualified for appointment if the criminal background check indicates convictions within seven years of appointment for crimes of violence crimes of moral turpitude crimes against persons felony theft or embezzlement crimes against government crimes against children are not subject to the seven year look back limitation applicants who fail a background check shall not be recommended to city council unless an appeal in subsection c3 is successful c 1 all background checks shall be conducted by the city department of human resources the director of human resources shall not disclose the background checks to anyone except the city manager andor city attorney 2 a negative background check shall be disclosed to the applicant 3 an applicant may appeal the director of human resources decision not to recommend an applicant based on an unfavorable criminal background check to the city manager whose decision shall be to 3123213 created  appointment qualifications and terms of members there is hereby created a planning and zoning commission for the city consisting of nine members five members of whom shall be registered electors of the city and shall be appointed by the city council in the following manner and for the following terms the original five members shall be appointed by the council to serve terms as follows one member for one year  one member for two years  one member for three years  one member for four years  and one member for five years as the term of each member expires the vacancy thus created shall be filled by a majority vote of the council for a term of three years if a vacancy occurs other than by expiration of term the council by a majority vote shall appoint a new member to fill the unexpired term the four remaining members shall be ex officio members without vote and shall consist of the city manager the zoning administrator the city engineer and the mayor of the and terms of members there is hereby created a tree commission for the city consisting of five members all of whom shall be city residents and shall be appointed by the city council in the following manner and for the following terms the original five members shall be appointed by the city council to serve terms as follows two members for one year  two members for two years  and one member for three years as the term of each member expires the vacancy thus created shall be filled by a majority vote of the city council for a term of three years if a vacancy occurs other than by expiration of term the city council by a majority vote shall appoint a new member to fill the expired terms the three remaining members of the commission shall be ex officio members without vote and shall consist of one city councilmember the parks and recreation director a representative from the colorado state forest service and one of the members of the commission shall be trained or experienced as a landscape horticulturist if available  absence from meetings should a member be absent for three consecutive regular meetings of such tree commission without cause the office of such member shall be deemed to be vacant and the term of such member terminated and the secretary of the tree commission shall immediately inform the city council of such termination an absence due to illness or an unavoidable absence from the city and notice thereof the secretary of the tree commission on or before the day of any regular meeting by such tree commission shall be deemed absence for cause a regular meeting as provided for by law or by rule of the tree commission or any regularly advertised public hearing shall be deemed a regular meeting  election and term of chairmancreation and filling of other offices the tree commission shall elect its chairman from among the appointed members and shall create and fill such other of its offices as it may determine the term of the chairman shall be one year with the eligibility for reelection the position of chairman shall be filled at the first regular meeting of each year  regular meetingscalling of special meetings the tree commission shall hold at least one regular meeting in each month during the months of january september of each year and such special meetings as are necessary in the opinion of the chairman  provided that a special meeting may be called by any three members of the tree commission or the parks and recreation director upon due notice to the chairman and the other members of the tree commission  adoption of procedural rulesrecords the tree commission shall adopt rules for transaction of business and shall keep a record of its meetings resolutions transactions findings and determinations which record shall be a public record  majority vote required for adoption extension or amendment of plans in voting upon the adoption of any plan or any part thereof or any amendment extension or addition by resolution of the tree commission the same must be carried by the affirmative vote of a simple majority of the entire voting membership of the tree commission  powers and duties generally the tree commission shall perform the following duties a to study investigate plan advise report and recommend to city council any action program plan or legislation which the commission shall find or determine to be necessary or advisable for the care preservation trimming planting removal or disposition of trees and shrubs in public ways streets and alleys  b to assist the city council and the citizens of the city in the dissemination of news and information regarding the selection planting and maintenance of trees within the corporate limits whether the same be on private or public property and to make such recommendations from time to time to the city council as to desirable legislation concerning the tree program and activities for the municipality  c to provide regular and special meetings at which the subject of trees insofar as it relates to the municipality may be discussed by the members of the commission officers and personnel of the municipality and all others interested in the tree program  d to study and to recommend to city council a master street tree and shrub plan for the city  e chairman should stay in regular communication with the parks and recreation director  preliminary and final reportspublic hearings such tree commission shall make preliminary reports and hold public hearings thereon before submitting final reports to the city repealed  repealed  repealed  repealed  repealed  repealed  chapter 4  alcoholic beverages local option premises license a optional premises licenses may be allowed within the city of cortez b licenses may be issued to motel premises that have licenses for the sale of alcoholic beverages c such licenses may be issued to allow said motelhotels to allow the establishment to let patrons have or consume alcoholic beverages in their rooms or at the swimming pool area if it has a swimming pool d the establishment shall ensure that only their employees take the beverages from the bar area to the room e the establishment shall not allow beverages to be taken out on any parking lot or any areas of the premises not specifically set forth herein f application requirements 1 a map or other drawing illustrating the pool area and hours access will be provided to individual rooms  2 a description of the method which shall be used to identify the boundaries of the optional premises when it is in use and how the licensee will ensure alcoholic beverages are not removed from such premises  3 a description of the provisions which will be made to control the dispensing of alcoholic beverages to minor or visibly intoxicated individuals g a violation of this chapter shall be punishable as set forth in cortez city a now in effect or as may be amended from time to time   92512 licensing for the golf course a definitions for the purposes of this section the following words or phrases shall have the meanings set forth 1 optional premises means the same as that defined in the colorado liquor section 124710322 and section 1247130 crs the types of licenses authorized in this section are optional premises or hotel restaurant with optional premises which may be referred to as optional premises unless otherwise stated b standards the following standards are for the issuance of an optional premises license the standards are adopted pursuant to the provisions of section 1247310 crs the standards adopted shall be considered in addition to all other standards applicable to the consideration of andor issuance of licenses under the colorado liquor any and all applicable local laws rules and regulations c form of application application for the optional premises license shall be made to the city clerk on forms which shall contain the following information in addition to information required by the state the application shall be heard publicly by the local hearing officer 1 a map or other drawing illustrating the optional premises boundaries and the location of the proposed optional premises license requested  2 proposed locations for permanent temporary or moveable structures which are proposed to be used for the sale or service of alcohol beverages and a statement as to whether mobile carts will be used for the sale or service of alcohol beverages  3 a description of the method which shall be used to identify the boundaries of the optional premises license when it is in use and how the licensee will ensure alcohol beverages are not removed from such premises  4 proof of the applicants right to possession of the optional premises including a legal description and supporting documentation to the satisfaction of the local licensing authority  5 a description of the provisions including a description of facilities which have been made for storing the alcohol beverages in a secured area on or off the optional premises and for future use on the optional premises if or when alcohol beverages are not served  and 6 a description of the provisions which will be implemented to control over service and prevent under age service of alcohol beverages d eligibility the licensee is either a holder of a hotelrestaurant license which is located on or adjacent to an eighteenhole golf course or is the operatorowner of a golf course within the city limits e size of premises there is no minimum size other than being a regulation eighteenhole course of the optional premises license or number of optional premises licenses for the licensee f additional conditions nothing contained in this section shall preclude the licensing authority in its discretion from imposing conditions restrictions or limitations on any optional premises license in order to serve the public health safety and welfare any such conditions may be imposed when the license is initially issued issued for any specific event or renewed the authority shall have the right to deny any request for an optional premises license or it may suspend or revoke the optional premises license in accordance with the procedures specified by law  tastings a a retail liquor store or liquorlicensed drugstore licensee who wishes to conduct tastings shall submit an application or application renewal to the cortez city clerk on forms provided by the city clerk the cortez city council sitting as the local licensing authority shall reject the application if the applicant fails to establish that he she or it is able to conduct tastings without violating the provisions of this section or creating a public safety risk to the neighborhood the neighborhood shall be the city of cortez city council shall establish its own application procedure and shall charge a reasonable application fee set by annual resolution as part of the citys annual budget process b tastings shall be subject to the following limitations 1 tastings shall be conducted only by a person or persons who have completed a server training program that meets the standards established by the colorado liquor enforcement division in the colorado department of revenue and who is either a retail liquor store licensee or a liquorlicensed drugstore licensee or an employee of a licensee tastings shall take place only on a licensees licensed premises 2 the alcohol used in tasting shall be purchased licensed wholesaler licensed brew pub or winery licensed pursuant to crs 1247403 at a cost that is not less than the laidin cost of such alcohol 3 the size of an individual alcohol sample shall not exceed one ounce of malt or vinous liquor or onehalf of one ounce of spirituous liquor 4 tastings shall not exceed a total of five hours in duration per day which need not be consecutive 5 tastings shall be conducted only during the operating hours in which the licensee on whose premises the tastings occur is permitted to sell alcohol beverages and in no case earlier than  am or later than  pm 6 the licensee shall prohibit patrons from leaving the licensed premises with an unconsumed sample 7 the licensee shall promptly remove all open and unconsumed alcohol beverage samples from the licensed premises or shall destroy the samples immediately following the completion of the tasting 8 the licensee shall not serve a person who is under twentyone years of age or who is visibly intoxicated 9 the licensee shall not serve more than four individual samples to a patron during a tasting 10 alcohol samples shall be in open containers and shall be provided to a patron free of charge 11 tastings may occur on no more than four of the six days from a monday to the following saturday not to exceed one hundred four days per year 12 no manufacturer of spirituous or vinous liquors shall induce a licensee goods or financial or inkind assistance to favor the manufacturers products being sampled at a tasting the licensee shall bear the financial and all other responsibility for a tasting c a violation of a limitation specified in this section 43 of the cortez city of section crs 1247801 by a retail liquor store or liquorlicensed drugstore licensee whether by his or her employees agents or otherwise shall be the responsibility of the retail liquor store or liquorlicensed drugstore licensee who is conducting the tasting d a retail liquor store or liquorlicensed drugstore licensee conducting a tasting shall be subject to the same revocation suspension and enforcement provisions as otherwise apply to the licensee e nothing in this section 43 tastings of the cortez city affect the ability of a colorado winery licensed pursuant to crs 1247402 or 1247403 to conduct a tasting pursuant to the authority of crs 12474022 or 12474032e f a violation of this ordinance shall be punished as set forth in section 1716a of the cortez city in affect or as may be amended from time to time  liquor distances from schools there is a five hundredfoot restriction between schools and all businesses for liquor licenses other than hotel and restaurant licenses     distances requirements a any distance to be computed regarding the distances applicable to liquor licensees where a distance requirement has been established by either state or local law shall be measured as follows b said distance shall be computed by direct measurement from the nearest property line of the land used for nonlicensee purposes to the main entry of the building in which malt vinous spirituous liquors are to be sold using a route of direct pedestrian access measured as a person would walk safely and properly without trespassing with right angles at crossings and with the observance of traffic regulations and lights   outdoor diningcentral business district a the outdoor dining policy is consistent with the citys master plan by enhancing the downtown experience in the street when applicable space exists the outdoor dining license shall only apply to only that area of sidewalk or street adjoining such establishments subject to the limitations herein c outdoor dining impact to neighboring businesses e boundaries which delineate licensed dining areas shall include approved railings between thirtysix inches and fortytwo inches in height no permanent modifications to activities or specified anatomical areas shall comply with the requirements of this article as follows a upon application for a sexually oriented business license the application shall be accompanied by a diagram of the premises showing a plan thereof specifying the location of one or more managers stations the location of all overhead lighting fixtures and designating any portion of the premises at which patrons will not be permitted a managers station may not exceed thirtytwo square feet of floor area with no dimension greater than eight feet the diagram shall also designate the place at which this license will be conspicuously posted a professionally prepared diagram in the nature of an engineers or architects blueprint shall not be required  however each diagram should be oriented to the north or to some designated street or object and should be drawn to a designated scale with marked dimensions sufficient to show the various internal dimensions of the interior of the premises to an accuracy of plus or minus six inches the licensing officer may waive the foregoing diagram for renewal applications if the applicant adopts a diagram that was previously submitted and certifies that the configuration of the premises has not been altered since it was prepared the application shall be sworn to be true and correct by applicant b at least one employee must be on duty and situated at each managers station at all times that any patron is present inside the premises c no alteration in the configuration or location of a managers station may be made without the prior approval of the city or its designee d it is the duty of the owners and operators of the premises to ensure that at least one employee is on duty and situated at each managers station at all times that any patron is present inside the premises e the interior of the premises shall be configured in such a manner that there is an unobstructed view from a managers station of every area of the premises to which any patron is permitted access for any purpose excluding restrooms restrooms may not contain video display equipment if the premises has two or more managers stations designated then the interior of the premises shall be configured in such a manner that there is an unobstructed view of each area of the premises to which any patron is permitted access for any purpose from at least one of the managers stations the view required in this subsection must be by direct line of sight from the managers station the view area shall remain unobstructed by any doors walls merchandise display racks or other materials at all times and no patron shall be permitted access to any area of the premises which has been designated as an area in which patrons will not be permitted in the application filed pursuant to sections 4a5 of this chapter f no door screen or other covering shall be placed or allowed to remain on any peep booth and no holes or openings shall be placed or allowed to remain in the wall between any two adjacent peep booths the door or doors opening into the booth or room shall be incapable of being locked or otherwise fastened so that it or they will freely open from either side partitions between peep booths shall be considered nonbearing partitions but they shall be so constructed as to have a fireresistance rating of not less than one hour or shall have approved sprinklers g it shall be the duty of the owners and operators and it shall also be the duty of any agents and employees present on the premises to ensure that the view area specified in subsection e of this section remains unobstructed by any doors walls merchandise display racks or other materials or persons at all times and to ensure that no patron is permitted access to any area of the premises which has not been designated as an area which patrons will not be permitted in the application filed pursuant to this section h one clear window facing the major portion of the licensed premises covering not less than onefourth of the wall area into which the window is set or a minimum size of two feet by two feet whichever is greater which window shall not be covered or obstructed in any manner while the booth or room is in use i no peep booth may be occupied by more than one person at one time no holes shall be allowed in the walls or partitions that separate each viewing room from adjoining viewing room or restroom j a person having a duty under this section commits a misdemeanor if heshe knowingly fails to fulfill the duties imposed by this section k the as measured at the floor level it shall be the duty of the owners and operators and it shall also be the duty of any agents and employees present on the premises to ensure that the illumination cleaning of licensed premises requirements each licensed premises shall be maintained in a clean and sanitary condition and shall be cleaned at least once daily and more frequently when necessary this activity shall be supervised by the person in charge of the licensed premises there shall be provided adequate facilities equipment and supplies on the licensed premises to meet this requirement and adequate ventilation and illumination shall be provided to permit thorough complete cleaning of the entire licensed premises trash and garbage shall not be permitted to accumulate or to become a nuisance on or in the immediate vicinity of the licensed premises but shall be disposed of daily or as often as necessary  part selfinspection of premises by licensee the licensee of licensed premises or his designated representative shall make sanitary inspections of the licensed premises at least once a month and shall record his findings on a form supplied by the licensing officer each licensed premises shall post and maintain in a readily accessible place a schedule for maintaining the sanitation of the premises  part sealing of unsanitary or unsafe conditions a licensed premises or any part thereof may be sealed by order of the licensing officer on his findings of a violation of this chapter resulting in an unsanitary or unsafe condition prior to sealing the licensing officer shall serve on the licensee by personal service on him or by posting in a conspicuous place on the licensed premises a notice of the violation and an order to correct it within twentyfour hours after service if the violation is not so corrected the licensing officer may physically seal that portion of the licensed premises causing the violation and order the discontinuance of use thereof until the violation has been corrected and the seal removed by the licensing officer the licensing officer shall affix to the sealed premises a conspicuous sign labeled unclean or unsafe as the case may be penalties in addition to or in lieu of the penalties that may be otherwise imposed the licensing officer may assess the following civil penalties a a person who operates or attempts to operate an adult bookstore adult cabaret adult motel adult arcade massage parlor adult motion picture theater adult theater or peep booth without having first obtained a license under this chapter may be assessed a civil penalty of up to three hundred dollars b an applicant for a license under this chapter and any officer director partner agent or attorney of such an applicant who knowingly makes a false statement or provides false information on any document or paper accompanying and forming a part of such application shall be assessed a civil penalty of up to two hundred dollars for each such false statement or false item of information c a licensee or employee who fails or refuses to renew his license within the period granted herein may be assessed a civil penalty of up to fifty dollars for each day beyond said period that said refusal or failure continues but not to exceed three hundred dollars for each refusal or failure d a licensee and any agent officer servant or employee of a licensee who maintains a nuisance on the licensed premises or permits the licensed premises to be unsanitary or unsafe may be assessed a civil penalty of up to one hundred dollars for each day that the nuisance or unsafe or unsanitary condition continues e a licensee who moves his licensed premises without approval by the licensing officer or who changes the name of his business without notifying the licensing officer may be assessed a civil penalty up to three hundred dollars f a licensee or employee who does not keep the records and make the reports required by any of the agencies herein may be assessed a civil penalty of up to fifty dollars for each violation g a licensee any agent officer servant or employee of a licensee who fails to correct violations of the general and applicable special requirements for the licensed premises may be assessed a civil penalty of up to two hundred dollars for each violation observed and not corrected within the period prescribed by the licensing officer the building official or the fire chief as the case may be h any person who aids or participates in a violation for which a civil penalty may be assessed under this chapter shall be considered a principal in the violation and may be assessed a civil penalty of up to the maximum amount prescribed for that violation i nothing herein contained shall prevent or restrict the city from taking such other lawful action in any court of competent jurisdiction as is necessary to prevent or remedy any violation or noncompliance such other lawful actions shall include but not be limited to an equitable action for injunctive relief or an action at law for damages all remedies and penalties provided for herein shall be cumulative and independently available to the city and the city shall be authorized to pursue any and all remedies set forth in this section to the full extent of the law  part assessment and recovery of civil penalty civil penalties shall be assessed by the licensing definitions for the purposes of this chapter the following words and phrases shall have the meanings respectively ascribed to them by this section dog a domestic canine of either sex including one neutered or sterilized cat a domestic feline of either sex including one neutered or sterilized owner any adult person keeping or harboring a dog or cat for a period of seven days or more or any household having a dog or cat in its possession shall be presumed to be the owner of such dog or cat running at large a dog shall be deemed to be running at large when it is off or away from the premises of its owner or keeper or is not under direct control of such owner or keeper either by leash cord or chain harboring the act of keeping and caring for an animal or of providing a premises to which the animal returns for food shelter or care for a period of seven days or more fierce dangerous or vicious propensities a dog that bites attacks or charges human beings or other animals unless such dog is provoked into making such an attack by acts designed to and having the effect of provoking such an animal to bite or attack or charge a person or animal making provocative attacks a dog that in a vicious and terrorizing manner attacks or approaches or charges in apparent attitude of attack upon a person or other animal without provocation upon a street sidewalk or other public ground or other places to include the curtilage of private property normally open to the public  provided however that if such biting or attacks occurs upon the premises of the owner of the animal and the person or animal so bitten or attacked is not an invited guest business or other authorized visitor this definition shall not apply to such dog inoculation vaccination or vaccination for rabies the inoculation of an animal shall be with a vaccine listed in the compendium of animal rabies control    license required it shall be unlawful for any person or persons to keep harbor or allow to remain on the premises any male or female dog or male or female cat over the age of four months within the corporate limits of the city unless such person shall first obtain a license for such dog or cat in order for a dog or cat license to be issued a current rabies vaccination is required the vaccination requirement shall be in accordance with the compendium of animal rabies control if there is no proof of a current rabies vaccination a dog or cat license deposit must be left at the city animal shelter at the time of reclaiming an impounded animal the license will then be issued upon verification of a current rabies vaccination to be provided by the dog or cat owner or by the veterinarian who has done the vaccination the license shall be obtained by paying to the chief of police or an authorized representative a license fee as set by the city council by resolution it shall be unlawful for a person or persons to maintain on any premises more than four dogs over ten weeks of age without first applying for and receiving a conditional use permit to operate the premises as a kennel    issuance of tag and receipt upon the payment of such license fee the chief of police or an authorized representative shall issue a license tag and receipt to the owner or person obtaining a license for such dog or cat    persons required to pay the fee such fees as required shall be paid by the owner or person in charge of each and every dog remaining or residing within the city or at any time thereafter brought into the city for residence or keeping  fees generally such fees shall be paid pro rata for the remainder of the year within which such dog is in or is brought into the city for residence or keeping  expiration of fees license fees shall be due and payable on the date of the rabies vaccination the license shall expire on the date the rabies vaccination expires rabies vaccination periods may be one or three years    tags to be worn by dogs all dogs shall wear or otherwise carry a license tag upon the collar or harness to be worn at all times within the city limits the owner of any cat shall provide proof of rabies vaccination upon request in the event of any loss or destruction of the original tag the owner of the dog shall obtain a replacement tag from the chief of police or an authorized representative at a cost to be set by the city council by resolution      rabies controlvaccination required it shall be the duty of every person who owns or harbors any dog or cat in the city to have such dog or cat inoculated by a person legally authorized to do so vaccinations shall be performed as set forth in the compendium of animal rabies control as promulgated by the national association of state public health veterinarians    chief of police to supply certificates and tags the chief of police shall prepare certificates in triplicate together for distribution to persons legally authorized to vaccinate animals for rabies spaces for the following information and for any other such information as the chief of police may require to be filled in by persons legally authorized to vaccinate animals shall be provided minimum information requirements shall be as follows a the name and address of the owner or harborer of the inoculated animal  b date of rabies inoculation  c expiration date of rabies inoculation  d the year and rabies tag number of the animal tag  e breed age color and sex of the inoculated animal    information required on tags rabies tags issued by persons qualified to vaccinate animals shall be made of a durable material suitable to be attached to the collar or harness of an inoculated animal such tags shall state the following a the year of issue b rabies vaccination c the name of the clinic d city and state e clinics telephone number f rabies tag number the cost of the inoculation shall be paid by the owner of the animal    duties of persons performing vaccinations it shall be the duty of each person legally authorized to perform vaccinations on animals when inoculating any dog or cat to fill out one triplicate certificate obtained from the chief of police with the information required and immediately present one triplicate copy to the owner or harborer of the inoculated animal one triplicate copy will then be mailed to the chief of police or an authorized agent on a monthly basis the remaining triplicate copy shall be retained by the person performing the vaccination at the time of a rabies inoculation of any dog or cat the person performing the rabies vaccination shall also provide to the owner or harborer of such animal a rabies tag as evidence of such rabies inoculation    tags to be worn by dogscertificates retained by owner every owner or harborer of a dog shall attach the tag evidencing inoculation of antirabies vaccine to the collar or harness of the inoculated dog and such collar or harness shall be worn by the animal at all times the copy of the certificate shall be retained by the owner or harborer of the inoculated dog for inspection by the chief of police or his authorized representative  certificate required as proof it shall be unlawful for any person who owns or harbors a vaccinated animal to fail or refuse to exhibit his copy of the certificate of vaccination to any person charged with enforcement of this chapter  chief of police to keep official registry the chief of police or an authorized representative shall file and register copies of such triplicate certificates received as provided in this chapter and retain and file such as the official registry of all dogs and cats inoculated with antirabies vaccine for the city such vaccination registration shall be valid for a period from the date the vaccination was given until the date of its expiration in accordance with the type of vaccine and its expiration date    free vaccinations at the discretion of the chief of police the chief of police may at his discretion provide for vaccination of any dog without cost or at a reduced rate to the owner or harborer thereof in hardship cases and in such instances that vaccination services are not available elsewhere for a reasonable fee  possession of certificates and tags only those persons who legally own or harbor a dog legally vaccinated in accordance with the provisions of this chapter shall be permitted to possess the certificate and tag as evidence of a rabies vaccination no person or persons may affix a rabies tag evidencing a rabies vaccination to the collar or harness of any dog or cat except the tag issued for the animal at the time of vaccination    authority of humane officer any police officer humane officer or other officer as designated by the chief of police is authorized to enforce any duties by a using or threatening to use physical force or violence against the humane officer or another  b using any other means which creates a substantial risk of causing physical injury to the must be set back at least ten feet from the property line 5 roosters are prohibited 6 the chicken enclosures shall not be kept in a manner which constitutes a nuisance safety hazard or health problem 7 the city may require a permit for the keeping of chickens 8 the municipal judge is hereby authorized and directed to impose increased penalties for subsequent violations by the same owner or keeper shows and similar functions provided that such animals shall not be kept upon such premises more than one week prior to or one week subsequent to the rodeo fair horse show or similar function  riding leading or driving horses mules cattle or goats on certain public areas it shall be unlawful for any person to ride lead or drive horses mules cattle or goats on a public park or public sidewalk in the city or upon any of the parkway located in the center of the street within the city  releasing penned animals it shall be unlawful to break open or in any manner directly or indirectly aid or assist in breaking open any pen enclosure or cage with the intent of releasing any animal contained therein it shall be unlawful for any person to remove any impounded animal from the animal shelter pound or kennel without the consent of the humane officer or designated officer or agency  maintenance of certain animal yards it shall be unlawful for any person who lawfully keeps any horse mule cow sheep goat poultry or any other animal within the city to permit the yard or place therein which such animals are kept to become foul noisome putrid malodorous unwholesome or offensive or in any way dangerous or detrimental to human health comfort or welfare any place so maintained is hereby declared to be a nuisance and shall be subject to abatement  maintenance of swine or dangerous reptiles it shall be unlawful for any person to maintain or keep any swine or poisonous or dangerous reptile within the city  maintenance of horses goats etcetera it shall be unlawful for any person to maintain or keep any horse mule cattle sheep or goats within the city within one hundred fifty feet of any building occupied as a residence or place of human habitation restaurant church public building or public park other than the keepers own residence or place of business animals so kept or maintained shall not be permitted to run at large within the city  burial of dead animals and fowl no person shall bury or cause to be buried any dead animals or fowl or part thereof within the city any person having any dead animal or fowl unfit for food an animal or fowl sick or injured and past recovery or any animal or fowl in an offensive condition on his premises within the city shall at once remove or cause such animal or fowl to be removed to the sanitary landfill at his own expense  maintenance of animals that disturb the peace it shall be unlawful for any person to keep or maintain any animal within the city which habitually or with regularity disturbs the peace and quiet of the neighborhood to include but not limited to excessive barking whining or howling molesting passersby chasing vehicles bicycles or people attacking other domestic animals depositing excretory matter on property other than that of the owner damaging property or repeatedly running at large the keeping of any such animal is hereby declared to be a nuisance  poisoning of animals it shall be unlawful for any person to poison a domestic animal or to distribute poison or toxicants on public or private property in any manner whatsoever with the intent of poisoning any domestic animal  keeping of vicious animals it shall be unlawful for any person to keep harbor or have about any dog animal or reptile which has bitten attacked or molested any person or persons or keep harbor or have about any dog or animal with known tendencies toward being vicious illtempered or harmful no dog of fierce dangerous or vicious propensities nor female dog in heat or other animal shall be allowed to run at large or upon the premises of another other than the premises of the owner or keeper of such animal if any dog is found to be running at large it shall be taken up and impounded if any dangerous fierce or vicious animal so found at large cannot be safely taken up and impounded such animal may be slain by the chief of police or his designated representative without notice to owner or harborer  running at large a dog shall be deemed to be running at large and permitted by the owner to run at large under any of the following circumstances a when the dog is off or away from the premises of the owner or keeper thereof and not under the direct control of such owner or keeper either by leash cord or chain b when the dog is left unattended on any public property whether or not the dog is secured by a leash cord chain or other means  cruelty to animals abandoning animals it is hereby prohibited and shall be unlawful for any person to willfully abandon any animal or to withhold food or water or adequate shelter from any animal such that its health is endangered or it is caused to suffer unduly it is also prohibited to leave animals unattended in hot vehicles it shall also be unlawful for any person to torture torment beat kick strike mutilate injure disable tease provoke or needlessly kill any animal within the bounds of the city of cortez a violation of this section shall be punished as set forth in cortez city a now in effect or as may be amended from time to time     92512 allowing felines to disturb others it shall be unlawful for any person who harbors a feline animal cat to allow that animal to disturb other persons feline animals cats determined to be in fact disturbing others on property other than the property of the owner or harborer of the feline animal shall be taken up and impounded by the chief of police or his designated representatives by any means not designed to harm the animal impounded feline animals are subject to impound fees as set by resolution of the city council  city animal pound created there is hereby created a city animal pound which may be operated by local vendors on an annual contract basis which shall be operated under the direction and control of the chief of police all animals impounded shall be housed and cared for at the city animal pound  provided however that during an emergency period when pound facilities are inadequate the chief of police is authorized to make provisions for additional care and housing elsewhere all animals impounded shall be properly housed fed watered and cared for under the guidelines of the state of colorado department of health  impounding of animals running at large if any animal described in this chapter is found to be running at large in the city it shall be the duty of the chief of police or his authorized representative to take up and confine such animal in a secure place designated for that purpose animals injured on public property may be impounded and given adequate veterinary medical treatment pending notification of the owner if the injured animal is treated andor impounded the owner of such animal shall be liable for all expenses incurred in the treatment andor impoundment of the animal animals injured on public property or property other than the owners and the owner is unknown or unable to be promptly notified and the animal is obviously seriously injured and suffering the animal at the discretion of the chief of police or his authorized representative may be destroyed on sight without liability to the city or officers involved  notice of impoundment during the first working day of the impounding of any animal found running at large in violation of any provisions of this chapter a written notice shall be posted at the designated place of impoundment describing such animal the license tag number if any of such animal the name of such owner or reputed owner if known and the hour and date of impounding the owner of any animal so impounded may reclaim such animal upon presenting to the city animal shelter a receipt showing that such animal is properly licensed and vaccinated for rabies if required and upon payment to the city of all costs and charges incurred by the city for pickup and impounding of such animal if such dog or cat owner or harborer is unable to produce a valid rabies certificate a rabies deposit must be left at the city animal shelter which will be refunded once a rabies certification is presented and if presented within ten working days to the chief of police or an authorized agent charges for pickup and impounding any animal and for keeping any animal on a per diem basis shall be determined by the city council by resolution and hereinafter referred to as impoundment fee    disposition of unclaimed animals all animals impounded for running at large or otherwise impounded shall be kept for a minimum period of five days before disposal either by adoption or euthanasia the five days herein meaning days that the shelter is open to the public for redemption of animals with the following exceptions a the chief of police or his designated representative may determine that an animal without identification may be disposed of within three days if it is determined that the shelter has no additional resources for the animal or determines it to be dangerous b if the shelter receives the animal from the owner or representative of the owner it becomes the property of the shelter and may be disposed of by the shelter and in the manner that shelter policy dictates c if the animal is abandoned it becomes the property of the shelter and the chief of police or his designated representative may dispose of the animal in the manner and time that the chief of police or his designated representative determines d if an animal in the opinion of the chief of police or his designated representative is in great pain and suffering it may be euthanized after exhausting reasonable efforts to contact the owner if the owner is known the shelter will use reasonable efforts to contact the owner for up to twentyfour hours e an animal may be euthanized at any time when in the judgment of the chief of police or his designated representative it is dangerous and represents a threat to employees of the shelter or other animals at the expiration of five working days from the date of impoundment the animal may be adopted or disposed of by euthanization unless claimed by owner uncontrollable or vicious animals may be destroyed at the owners expense upon written authorization from the owner of the animal requesting prompt euthanization for valid and lawful reasons or as authorized by the chief of police or a designated representative if an injured or ill animal at the city animal shelter appears to be suffering the animal at the discretion of the chief of police or an authorized agent may be immediately euthanized if the animal has only minor injuries or sickness it will be made comfortable for the fiveday period as set forth in section 537 for unclaimed animals veterinarian treatment for sick animals within the shelter will be at the discretion of the chief of police or an authorized representative      quarantine and disposition of animals which bite or attack persons any dog or other animal which has bitten a person shall be observed for a period of ten days from the date of the bite the procedure and place of observation shall be designated by the investigating officer the chief of police or his authorized representative if the dog cat or other animal is not confined on the owners premises confinement shall be impoundment in the city animal pound or at any veterinary hospital of the owners choice such confinement shall be at the expense of the owner stray dogs cats or other animals whose owners cannot be located shall be confined in the city animal pound refusal to produce the dog cat or other animal upon request of the chief of police or his authorized representative constitutes a violation of this section and each day of such refusal constitutes a separate and individual violation  penalty any person who shall violate any of the provisions of this chapter shall be deemed guilty of a misdemeanor and shall upon conviction thereof shall be punished as set forth in cortez city a now in effect or as may be amended from time to 3115601d k   unsafe buildings all structures or existing equipment that are or hereafter become unsafe unsanitary or deficient because of inadequate means of egress facilities inadequate light and ventilation or which constitute a fire hazard or are otherwise dangerous to human life or the public welfare or which involve illegal or improper occupancy or inadequate maintenance shall be deemed an unsafe condition unsafe structures shall be taken down and removed or made safe as the building official deems necessary and as provided for in appropriate chapters of the currently adopted city construction codes   part   erection of buildings within potential flood areas  duties of building inspector and zoning and planning commission a the city building inspector shall review all building permit applications for new construction or substantial improvements to determine whether proposed building sites will be reasonably safe from flooding if a proposed building site is in a location that has a flood hazard any proposed new construction or substantial improvement including prefabricated and mobile homes must 1 be designed or modified and anchored to prevent flotation collapse or lateral movement of the structure  2 use construction materials and utility equipment that are resistant to flood damage  and 3 use construction methods and practices that will minimize flood damage b the city zoning and planning commission shall review subdivision proposals and other proposed new developments to assure that 1 all such proposals are consistent with the need to minimize flood damage  2 all public utilities and facilities such as sewer gas electrical and water systems are located elevated and constructed to minimize or eliminate flood damage  and 3 adequate drainage is provided so as to reduce exposure to flood hazards c the city zoning and planning commission shall require new or replacement water supply systems or sanitary sewage systems to be designed to minimize or eliminate infiltration of floodwaters into the systems and discharges from the systems into floodwaters and require onsite waste disposal systems to be located so as to avoid impairment of them or contamination from them during flooding    repealed  for state law as to authority of city to adopt by reference see crs 197  3116202 to 3116204   repealed    repealed    nfpa211 standard adopted a
