numbering of buildings for state law as to authority of city to compel the numbering of buildings see crs 197  31 15601i house defined for the purposes of this article the word house shall mean any building used for dwelling or business purposes  system established  street designations and operation of system generally a the intersection of main and market streets shall be the base points for such numbering system main street shall be the base for the numbering of houses on streets running north or south or at a relative curve or angle from main street market street shall be the base for the numbering of houses on streets running east or west or at a relative curve or angle from market street b all streets running north south east or west or at a relative curve or angle from the base street shall contain the appropriate prefix north south east or west as a part of the official name of such street c the north and east sides of streets shall be even numbers and the numbers on the south or west sides of street shall be odd numbers d there is hereby established a number for each twelve and onehalf feet which number shall be in consecutive odd or even order depending upon the side of the street beginning with 1 and 2 at the property adjacent to the base street  numbers in the first block from the base street shall be from 1 to 99 in the second block from 100 to 199 and in such manner each block removed from the base street shall begin a new hundred serial in new subdivisions the 125 foot distance for numbering shall be followed as closely as is reasonably possible but with modifications that may seem necessary    display and regulation of number plates each house within the limits of the city shall display in a prominent place upon the front side of such house a number plate and number which shall be of uniform size style and type as follows a all numbers shall be upon a reflector type plate b all plates shall be nine inches by three and onefourth inches in size c all numbers shall be three inches by three inches in size d all plates shall be made of metal with glass face with black background and white reflector numbers  building official to furnish information the building official shall upon request furnish information as to the correct number or numbers applicable to any house upon being furnished with the proper lot and block number  compliance with article required it shall be unlawful for any person owning or having control of any house within the city limits to fail or refuse to comply with the provisions of this article    street numbering in certain annexed areas and subdivisions a notwithstanding any language in this article to the contrary from and after the effective date of the ordinance codified in sections 6111 it shall be the duty of the city manager and his staff and he is likewise empowered and directed to cause to be examined all official plats of annexed areas and subdivisions now on file or to be hereafter filed with the city of cortez b upon such examination it shall be his duty aided by his staff to assign numbers to each lot platted on such plat and to cause such number to be engraved on the official plat of the city whether any such lot is vacant or occupied by a building c such numbering of said lots shall be in an orderly sequential manner so that each lot bears a logical numbering sequence with all other lots in said subdivision or addition to the end that confusion and duplication of numbers within said subdivision or addition will be avoided d such plats after the numbers have been engraved thereon shall be indexed and preserved in an orderly filing system in the city administration building and it shall be the duty of all persons owning a structure erected upon such lot to display a number plate upon such building as required by section 67 of this article e after all numbers have been engraved on said official plats it shall be the duty of the city manager to notify the owner or occupant of the official number assigned to said premises with a demand that such number be attached to any building thereon f if any such lot is vacant and unoccupied it shall be the duty of the city building inspector to notify the owner of any building to be thereafter erected thereon of such official number and the same shall be printed on any building permit thereafter issued    official status of such numbers a the numbers engraved on such lots or parcels of land within said annexed areas andor subdivisions shall be deemed to be the official house or building number for all purposes including but not limited to mail service united states postal system or any other authorized delivery service serving the inhabitants of such annexed area andor subdivision    conflicts a in the numbering of such lots should it appear that any structure has affixed a house or business number thereon which conflicts with the orderly sequential numbers engraved thereon it shall be the duty of the owner of such house or business building to remove such conflicting number and to install the proper number upon being notified of such conflict by the city manager    street renumbering in the city a notwithstanding any language in this article to the contrary from and after the effective date of the ordinance codified in this section it shall be the duty of the city manager and his staff and he is likewise empowered and directed to cause to be examined the entire numbering system and street naming system in the city of cortez and upon such examination it shall be his duty aided by his staff to assign or reassign numbers to each business lot or individual tract such numbering shall be in an orderly sequential manner so that each identified area bears a logical numbering sequence with all the others in that area to the end that confusion and duplication and improper spacing of numbers shall be avoided or corrected b such numbers shall be indexed and preserved in an orderly filing system in the city administration building on official plats and it shall be the duty of all persons owning a structure erected upon such lot to display a number plate on such building as required by of this article c after all such numbers have been assigned and placed on such official plats it shall be the duty of the city manager and his staff to notify the owneroccupant of the official number assigned to such premises with a demand that such number be attached to any building thereon d if any such lot is vacant and unoccupied it shall be the duty of the city building inspector to notify the owner of any building to be thereafter erected thereon of the official number and the same shall be printed on any building permit thereafter issued e conflicts if in the numbering of such lots tracts or premises as hereinbefore provided should it appear that any structure has been affixed to a house or business the number therein which conflicts with the orderly sequential numbers engraved thereon it shall be the duty of the owner of such lot tract or premises to remove such conflicting numbers and to install a proper number on the improvements upon being notified of such conflict by the city manager  building department building official and board of appeals building department created there is hereby established in the city the building department which shall be under the jurisdiction of the building official designated by the appointing authority  building officialpowers and duties generally a generally the building official is hereby authorized and directed to enforce all the provisions of the currently adopted city construction codes b appointment of deputies in accordance with the procedure and with the approval of the chief appointing authority of the municipality the building official may appoint such number of officers inspectors assistants and other employees as shall be authorized from time to time he may deputize such employees as may be necessary to carry out the functions of the building department c reports and records the building official shall submit a report to the proper city official not less than once a year covering the work of the department during the preceding period he shall incorporate in such report a summary of his recommendations as to desirable amendments to the currently adopted city construction codes d account of fees and monies the building official shall keep a permanent accurate account of all fees and other monies collected and received under the currently adopted city construction codes the names of the persons upon whose account the same were paid the date and amount thereof together with the location of the building or premises to which they relate   part sameright of entry for inspectionbuildings under construction whenever in the judgment of the building official or any of his deputies it becomes necessary to make an inspection of a building under construction the building official or his authorized representative shall have at all times right to enter upon the premises where such building is being constructed and upon presenting his credentials to the owner thereof or such person as is in charge of construction and stating his reasons therefor he shall then have the right to make such reasonable inspection of such premises to determine whether compliance with the provisions of the currently adopted city construction codes is met   part samesameoccupied building a inspection the building inspector or his authorized representative shall have the right during daylight hours to make an inspection of such occupied building whenever he has reasons to believe that such inspection is reasonably necessary to enforce any of the provisions of the currently adopted city construction codes  provided however that in case of an occupied building the building inspector must first present himself to the owner or occupant as the case may be and after presenting his credentials shall make a request for an inspection of the premises stating his reasons therefor if the owner or occupant should refuse entry to the building inspector after he has presented his credentials and stated his reasons for making such inspection and should the building inspector or his representative then believe that such refusal was arbitrary capricious or unreasonable the building inspector shall then have a right to file a complaint in the municipal court of the city charging the owner or occupant or both with unreasonable refusal to permit his inspection the court shall then set the matter for hearing and the defendant shall have the right to be represented at such hearing by counsel of his choice if the court should determine that the request for admittance by the building official or his representative was unreasonable capricious and without any basis and that the request for inspection was an unreasonable request then the court shall dismiss the matter on the other hand if the court should find that the reasons for inspection given by the building official or his authorized representative were not arbitrary unreasonable or capricious and that the refusal of the defendant to permit such inspection was in fact unreasonable arbitrary or capricious then the court may find the defendant guilty and he may be fined in the manner and to the extent as provided in this article b final inspection to ensure compliance with standards after the building inspector has completed his inspection he shall then deliver to the owner or occupant a written list of requirements necessary to comply with applicable portions of this the owner or occupant shall have a reasonable time to comply with such requirements upon so complying the owner or occupant shall notify the building inspector by certified mail of that fact and the inspector shall then have a right to make a final inspection to determine if such requirements have been met     part samesameunsafe buildings whenever the building official or his authorized representative has reasonable cause to believe that there exists in any building or upon any premises any condition which makes such building or premises unsafe as defined in section 67 of this the building official or his authorized representative shall first present himself to the owner thereof or the occupant and deliver to such owner or occupant written reasons why the building official believes that such premises are unsafe as defined herein if the owner or occupant believes that such reasons appear to be reasonable and that a dangerous condition does in fact exist then he may admit the building official or his representative to the premises to make such inspection to the end that such dangerous condition may be removed if on the other hand the owner or occupant believes that such request is arbitrary capricious or unreasonable and he should refuse such request then the building official shall have the right to file a complaint in the municipal court of the city charging such owner or occupant or both with such unreasonable refusal and the matter shall be heard by the court as provided in section 615 subsection a of this  samesameemergencies whenever in the judgment of the building official or his authorized representative it appears that there exists in a building a condition which poses an immediate threat to life or property and there is not sufficient time because of such emergency and the threat to human life or property in which to provide notice as in sections 614 to 616 of this the building official shall make every bona fide effort to locate the owner or occupant thereof and to notify him orally of the dangerous condition if the owner or occupant then refuses admission to the premises of the building official or his representative the building official with the aid of the city attorneys office may then apply for and obtain a mandatory injunction from the district court of the county such injunction to be ex parte and without notice as provided by law and with such injunctive order the building official or his representative may then enter the premises and take such steps as are necessary to remove the threat of harm to life limb or property as the case may be  provided however that if the threat is so pressing and the time within which to remedy the same is so short as to make it impossible to apply to the district court for such mandatory injunction and should the threat of harm to life limb or property be so grave and immediate that action must be taken at once the building official shall have the right in the company of the chief of police of the city and the chief of the fire department to enter such premises with or without consent of the occupant or owner in order to remove such dangerous condition or instrumentality authorized representative shall include the officers named in section 6112 subsection b no owner or occupant or any other person having charge care or control of any building or premises shall fail or neglect after proper demand is made as herein provided to promptly permit entry therein by the building official or his authorized representative for the purpose of inspection and examination pursuant to this article any person violating this section may be found guilty of a misdemeanor and upon conviction shall be subject to the fines set forth in section 626  samestopwork orders whenever any building work is being done contrary to the provisions of the currently adopted city construction codes the building official may order the work stopped by notice in writing served on any persons engaged in the doing or causing such work to be done and any such persons shall forthwith stop such work until authorized by the building official to proceed with the work   part sameoccupancy violations whenever any structure is being used contrary to the provisions of the currently adopted city construction codes the building official may order such use discontinued and the structure or portion thereof vacated by notice served on any person causing such use to be continued such person shall discontinue the use within ten days after receipt of such notice or make the structure or portion thereof comply with the requirements of the currently adopted city construction codes  provided however that in the event of an unsafe building section 67 of this apply   part sameliability the building official or any employee charged with the enforcement of the currently adopted city construction codes acting in good faith and without malice for the city in the discharge of his duties shall not thereby render himself liable personally and he is hereby relieved from all personal liability for any damage that may accrue to persons or property as a result of any act required or by reason of any act or omission in the discharge of his duties any suit brought against the building official or employee because of such act or omission performed by him in the enforcement of any provisions of the currently adopted city construction codes shall be defended by the legal department of the city until final termination of the proceedings   part samecooperation of other officials the building official may request and shall receive so far as may be necessary in the discharge of his generally see crs 197  282101 et seq mayor to establish program  scope of program the mayor of the city is hereby empowered and authorized to promulgate in writing such rules and regulations as may be reasonably necessary for the protection of life and property within the city from dangers or hazards created or increased by the existing state of war or for the coordinating of an efficient program of civilian defense including but not by way of limitation a defense of the city and its inhabitants against air raids or attack warnings to be given blackouts and care of persons and property during such emergency b prevention of sabotage of property within the city and designation of insignia and symbols to be used by authorized civil defense workers or organizations c control of traffic movements evacuation of residents systems of warning and alarm and conduct of persons during practice blackouts  mayor may delegate authority the mayor is authorized to delegate in writing to such agencies or persons as he may designate or appoint for such purpose the authority granted by this chapter  enforcement of chapter the law enforcement authorities of the city are authorized and directed to enforce the orders rules and regulations made or issued pursuant to this chapter  disclaimer of liability of city etc neither the city nor its agents or representatives who in good faith carry out comply with or attempt to carry out or comply with any order rule regulation or command promulgated pursuant to this chapter shall be liable for any injury or death to any person or damage to any property as the result of such activity  effect of section 74 on workmans compensation etc  chapter and rules promulgated thereunder deemed governmental function a shall not affect the right of any person to receive benefits or compensation to which he might otherwise be entitled under the workmans compensation act or other pension law b this chapter and any rules regulation or order promulgated hereunder shall constitute the exercise by the city of its governmental functions  chapter 7a  disposal of property property received as evidence safekeeping by officer pending dispositionrecords required when personal property comes into the possession of a police officer of the city either in execution of a search warrant or pursuant to an arrest of a person with or without warrant or is received or taken by him as evidence in connection with any public offense he shall hold it in safe custody until it is received into evidence or if it is not used as evidence until it can be disposed of as provided in this chapter while in the custody of such officer a proper record shall be maintained reflecting the ownership of the property if known and the case or cases for which it was taken or received and is being held art i   property turnover any property turned over to the cortez police department by any other law enforcement agency shall be subject to all provisions of this including being subject to destruction or return in accordance with the guidelines set forth in this chapter part return of property not needed as evidenceprocedure property so obtained which is not needed as evidence shall be returned to the owner if he may lawfully possess it when the police officer or the agency by which he is employed becomes aware that the property is not needed the district attorney andor the city attorney shall be so advised giving a description and details of ownership when the police chief or his designated agent by such notice or otherwise becomes aware that the property is not needed he shall give written notice to the owner upon proof of ownership and of lawfulness of possession satisfactory to the police chief the police chief shall give the owner written authorization which shall entitle the owner to receive the property from the person having custody of it when property so obtained is received in evidence it shall be retained by the clerk of the court last receiving it or shall be returned by him to the custody of the police officer until all direct appeals and retrials are final at which time the property shall be returned in accordance with this section in the event that the district attorney or city attorney considers it necessary to retain control over the evidence in anticipation of possible collateral attacks upon the judgment or of use in some potential prosecution he may decline to authorize return art ii   receipt from owner of returned property whenever property is returned to the owner a receipt shall be taken from him listing in detail the property returned the receipt shall be retained on record shall be held in accordance with colorado revised statutes 197  in the files of the city police department or the court where the case is finally resolved art iii sale of unclaimed propertydisposition of proceeds if the property is not claimed by the owner before the expiration of thirty days from the receipt of notice or if the owner is unknown and no claim of ownership has been made the city police department having possession of the property shall sell it at public auction as provided by law for the sale of personal property on execution and with the proceeds pay a the necessary expenses incurred in the preservation of such property and its sale  and b any balance to the director of finance under the provisions of of the charter the said property may also be destroyed at the discretion of the police chief or his designated representative art iv  part  part property seized from personduplicate receipts when money or other property is seized with or without a warrant the police officer seizing it shall at the time deliver a receipt to the person from whom it is taken and file a duplicate in the office of the city police department if the custody of the property is transferred to another police agency or the property is placed in evidence a copy of the receipt shall accompany it until disposition of the property is made in accordance with the provisions of this chapter art v found property storage period when personal property is turned over to the police department by citizens who found the same the property shall be stored by the city for a period of not less than thirty days or until someone who can establish themselves as the rightful owner claims and removes the property   part return to finder if the property is maintained for a period of thirty days and is unclaimed by any person then the property may be returned to the finder of the same who shall acknowledge receipt of the property the receipt shall contain the warning the city of cortez or the police department make no determination as to the legal ownership of the property but is returning same to the finder who first brought the property to the city of cortez if in the future there is any question concerning the true ownership of the property then the city of cortez has expressed no opinion as to the ownership and the question shall be resolved between the person who claims to be the legal owner and the party who returned the property to the city of cortez the receipt shall adequately describe the property   part unclaimed property the property will be disposed of in accordance with of this the event that the party turning the property into the city as lost property does not make a claim thereon within thirty days after the date of turning said property in to the city   part retention of receipts all receipts both from the city and from the finder who removes the property from the citys possession according to this article shall be retained for a period of at least three years  disposal of unclaimed property purpose of provisions the purpose of this article is to provide for the administration and disposition of unclaimed property which is in the possession of or under the control of the city  definitions unless otherwise required by context or use words and terms shall be defined as follows a director shall mean the director of finance or designee thereof b municipality means the city of cortez colorado c owner means a person or entity including a corporation partnership association governmental entity other than this municipality or a duly authorized legal representative or successor in interest of same which owns unclaimed property held by the municipality d unclaimed property means any tangible or intangible property including any income or increment derived therefrom less any lawful charges that is held by or under the control of the city and which has not been claimed by its owner for a period of more than five years after it became payable or distributable  procedure for disposition of property a prior to disposition of any unclaimed property having an estimated value of twentyfive dollars or more the director shall send a written notice by certified mail return receipt requested to the last known address of the owner as shown by the records of the municipal department holding the property the notice shall include a description of the purpose for which the property was deposited or otherwise held the notice shall state where the owner may make inquiry of or claim the property the notice shall also state that if the owner fails to provide the director with a written claim for the return of the property within thirty days of the date of the notice the property shall become the sole property of the municipality and any claim of the owner to such property shall be deemed forfeited b prior to disposition of any unclaimed property having an estimated value of less than twentyfive dollars or having no last known address of the owner the director shall cause a notice to be published in a newspaper of general circulation in the city the notice shall include a description of the property the owner of the property the amount or estimated value of the property and when available the purpose for which the property was deposited or otherwise held the notice shall state where the owner may make inquiry of or claim the property the notice shall also state that if the owner fails to provide the director with a written claim for the return of the property within sixty days of the date of the publication of the notice the property shall become the sole property of the municipality and any claim of the owner to such property shall be deemed forfeited c if the director receives no written claim within the thirtyday claim period the property shall become the sole property of the city and any claim of the owner to such property shall be deemed forfeited d if the director receives a written claim within the thirtyday claim period the director shall evaluate the claim and give written notice to the claimant within ninety days thereof that the claim has been accepted or denied in whole or in part the director may investigate the validity of a claim and may request further supporting documentation from the claimant prior to disbursing or refusing to disburse the property e in the event that there is more than one claimant for the same property the director may in the directors sole discretion resolve such claims or may resolve such claims by depositing the disputed property with the registry of the district court in an interpleader action f in the event that all claims filed are denied the property shall become the sole property of the city and any claim of the owner of such property shall be deemed forfeited g any legal action filed challenging a decision of the director shall be filed pursuant to rule 106 of the colorado rules of civil procedure within thirty days of such decision or shall be forever barred if any legal action is timely filed the property shall be disbursed by the director pursuant to the order of the court having jurisdiction over such claim h the director is authorized to establish and administer procedures for the administration and disposition of unclaimed property consistent with this article including compliance requirements for other municipal officers and employees in the identification and disposition of such property   part exceptions a any property which is held by the police department pursuant to the provision of municipal or said ordinances being codified as chapter 7a sections 7a1 to 7a9 shall be exempt from the provisions of this article and shall be disposed of in accordance with sections 7a1 to 7a9 b any property which is held by the city pursuant to the provisions of municipal codified as chapter 18a sections 18a1 shall be exempted from the provisions of this article and shall be disposed of in accordance with chapter 18 section 18a8  chapter 8  electricity chapter 9  finance and warrant issued or suit for collection be instituted nor any other action to collect the same be commenced more than three years after the date on which the tax was or is payable  nor shall any lien continue after such period except for taxes assessed before the expiration of such period notice of lien with respect to which has been filed prior to the expiration of such period in which cases such lien shall continue only for one year after the filing of notice thereof in the case of a false or fraudulent return with intent to evade tax the tax together with interest and penalties thereon may be assessed or proceedings for the collection of such taxes may be begun at any time before the expiration of such period of limitation the taxpayer and the director of finance may agree in writing to an extension thereof and the period so agreed on may be extended by subsequent agreements in writing b in the case of failure to file a return the sales tax use tax or both may be assessed and collected at any time c other remedies nothing in sections 95 and 96 shall preclude the city from utilizing any other applicable penalties or remedies for the collection or enforcement of sales or use taxes art 1  1 samestandard reporting form and maplocation guide a the city shall use the standard municipal sales and use tax reporting form and any subsequent revisions thereto adopted by the vendor may rely on such maplocation guide and any update thereof available to such vendor in determining whether to collect a sales or use tax or both no penalty shall be imposed or action for part      promulgation of rules to effectuate article to provide uniform methods of adding the tax or the average equivalent thereof to the selling price it shall be the duty of the director of required to be given to the retailer or vendor under the provisions of this article shall be in writing and if mailed shall be postpaid and sent by registered or certified mail return receipt requested to such retailer or vendor at his last known address the giving of such notice shall be sufficient for the purposes of this article  a  notice of sales and use tax ordinance amendment a in order to initiate a central register of sales and use tax ordinances for municipalities that administer local sales tax collection the finance director of the city shall file with the colorado municipal league prior to the effective date of this section a copy of the city sales and use tax ordinance reflecting all provisions in effect on the effective date of this section b in order to keep current the central register of sales and use tax ordinances for municipalities that administer local sales tax collection the finance director of the city shall file with the colorado municipal league prior to the effective date of any amendment a copy of each sales and use tax ordinance amendment enacted by the city c failure of the city to file such ordinance or ordinance amendment pursuant to the section shall not invalidate any provision of the sales and use tax ordinance or any amendment thereto  part license and tax to be in addition to other taxes etc the license and tax imposed by this article shall be in addition to all other licenses and taxes imposed by law except as otherwise provided by this article  administration of article the administration of this article is hereby vested in the director of finance who shall prescribe forms and reasonable rules and regulations in conformity with this article for the making of returns for the ascertainment assessment and collection of the taxes imposed hereunder and for a proper administration and enforcement hereof  a  participation in simplification meetings the finance director shall cooperate with and participate on an as needed basis with a permanent statewide sales and use tax committee convened by the colorado municipal league which is composed of state and municipal sales and use tax officials and business officials said committee will meet for the purpose of discussing and seeking resolution to sales and use tax problems which may arise  part enforcement of article  offenses prohibited generally it shall be unlawful for any retailer or vendor to refuse to make any return provided to be made under this article to make any false or fraudulent return or false statement on any return to fail and refuse to make payment to the director of finance of any taxes collected or due the city to in any manner evade the collection and payment of the tax or any part thereof or to aid or abet another in any attempt to evade the payment of the tax any person violating any of the provisions of this section shall be guilty of a violation of this article any court of competent jurisdiction shall have jurisdiction to enforce this section in addition to the foregoing offenses it shall be unlawful for any person to knowingly and willfully swear to or verify any false statement  purpose of tax  distribution of tax into general capital improvements and equipment funds a the city council hereby declares that except as otherwise provided in subsection c of this section the purpose of the levy of the taxes imposed by articles ii and iii of this chapter is for the raising of funds for the payment of the expenses of operating the city for improvements and for equipment acquisition and replacements in accordance with these purposes except as otherwise provided in subsection c of this section 786 percent of the revenue collected under iii of this chapter shall be deposited in the general fund of the city  143 percent of the revenue collected under articles ii and iii of this chapter shall be deposited in a capital streets improvements fund of the city for streets sidewalks public parking curb and gutter and storm drainage  and 71 percent of the revenue collected under articles ii and iii of this chapter shall be deposited in the equipment fund of the city b all revenue received by the city from the recreation sales tax shall be deposited into the family recreation center fund hereby established pursuant to section 6 of the cortez city charter revenues deposited into the family recreation center fund shall be expended solely for the purpose of constructing equipping operating and maintaining the family recreation center or for the payment of recreation bonds in any calendar year prior to the use of any revenues on deposit in the family recreation center fund for construction equipment operation or maintenance purposes a sufficient amount of revenues deposited in the family recreation center fund must first be allocated or applied to the payment of the principal of an interest due on recreation bonds during such calendar year in the event that any base sales tax revenues are deposited into the family recreation center fund pursuant to subsection c of this section the city council may in its sole discretion treat such deposit as an interfund loan to be repaid from recreation sales tax revenues at a later date c notwithstanding the allocation of revenues from the base sales tax revenues pursuant to subsection a of this section in the event that the city has recreation bonds outstanding and there is not or will not be sufficient revenues on deposit in the family recreation center fund for payment of the recreation bonds when due revenues from the base sales tax shall be deposited into the family recreation center fund solely for the purpose of paying the principal of and interest due on the recreation bonds      for charter provision as to general fund see char art vii  5 division 2  licenses required  application  fees it shall be unlawful for any person to engage in the business of selling at retail without first having obtained a license therefor which license shall be granted and issued by the director of finance and shall be in force and effect as long as they meet the provisions that follow such license will be invalidated and must be reissued and repurchased if there is a 1 change in business name or 2 change in business address or 3 change in business ownership such license shall be granted only upon application stating the name and address of the person desiring such a license the name of such business and its location including the street number of such business and such other facts as the director of finance may require for each license issued a fee of ten dollars shall be paid  required for each separate place of business in case business is transacted at two or more separate places by one person a separate license for each place of business shall be required  numbering  contents  display  transfer each license shall be numbered and shall show the name residence place and character of business of the licensee and shall be posted in a conspicuous place in the place of business for which it is issued no license shall be transferable  revocation by city manager the city manager on reasonable notice and after a full hearing may revoke the license of any person found by the city manager to have violated any provision of this article  review of revocation by city manager any finding and order of the city manager revoking the license of any person shall be subject to review by the district court of the district where the business of the licensee is conducted upon application by the aggrieved party the procedure for review shall be as nearly as possible the same as now provided for by rule 106 a 4 of the colorado rules of civil procedure  exemption of purchaser and seller as to whether or not any such sale is exempt from taxation under this article nevertheless the seller shall collect and the purchaser shall pay such tax and the seller shall thereupon issue to the purchaser a receipt or certificate on forms prescribed by the director of finance showing the names of the seller and purchaser the items purchased the date price amount of tax paid and a brief statement of the claim or exemption the purchaser thereafter may apply to the director of finance for a refund of such taxes and it shall then be the duty of the director of finance article on sales on which the exemption is disputed  taxation of grant of continuous use of tangible personal property by lease or contract a the sales tax on lease payments shall be paid by the shall be upon the lessor b payment and remittance of sales tax to the city shall be made on each payment made under the lease including each payment under any option to purchase contained in the lease each payment for termination of the lease and each payment for purchase of the leased property if same is sold to the lessee after termination of the lease regardless of the subsequent location of the property art 2  2 confidentiality of returns a divulging of information generally except in accordance with judicial order or as otherwise provided by this article the director of finance his agents clerks and employees shall not divulge any information gained from any return filed under the provisions of this article b use in court the officials charged with the custody of such returns shall not be required to produce any of them or evidence of anything contained in them in any action or proceeding in any court except on behalf of the director of finance in an action under the provisions of this article to which he is a party on behalf of any party to an action or proceeding under the provisions of this article or to punish a violator thereof when the report of facts shown by such report is directly involved in such action or proceeding however in either event the court may require the production of and may admit in evidence so much of such returns or of the facts shown thereby as are pertinent to the action or proceeding and no more c areas not covered nothing contained in this article shall be construed to prohibit the delivery to a person or his duly authorized representative of a copy of any return or report filed in connection with his tax nor to prohibit the publication of statistics so classified as to prevent the identification of particular reports or returns and the items thereof nor to prohibit the inspection by the city attorney or any other legal representative of the city of the report or return of any person who brings an action to set aside or review the tax based thereon or against whom an action or proceeding is contemplated or has been instituted under this article d preservation period reports and returns shall be preserved for three years and thereafter until the director of finance with approval of the city manager orders them destroyed e penalties it shall be unlawful for any city officer or employee or any member officer or employee of the office of the director of finance to divulge any information classified by this section as confidential in any manner except in accordance with proper judicial order or otherwise as provided by law  subdivision ii  computation tax levied  schedule of amounts there is hereby imposed a tax upon all sales of commodities and services specified in section 920 in accordance with the following schedule a on all sales three and onehalf percent shall be added to the selling price  and b in addition to the base sales tax imposed pursuant to subsection a of this section on all sales fiftyfive onehundredths of one percent shall be added to the selling price commending on  and terminating on the earliest permitted date following the payment in full of all recreation bonds  addition of amount to sales prices retailers shall add the tax imposed by section 926 or the average equivalent thereof to the sale price or charge showing such tax as a separate and distinct item and when added such tax shall constitute a part of such price or charge and shall be a debt from the consumer or user to the retailer until paid and shall be recoverable at law in the same manner as other debts the retailer shall be entitled as collecting agent of the city to apply and credit the amount of his collections against the current sales tax rate to be paid by him under the provisions of section 928 remitting any excess of collections over such current sales tax rate less the three and onethird percent collection expense allowance to the director of finance of the city in the retailers next monthly sales tax return    liability of retailer for payment  returns generally  penalty for late payments a every retailer shall irrespective of the provisions of section 926 be liable and responsible for the payment of an amount equivalent to the current sales tax rate on all sales made by him of commodities or services as specified in section 920 and shall before the twentieth day of each month make a return to the director of finance for the preceding calendar month and remit an amount equivalent to the current sales tax rate on such sales to the director of finance less one and onethird percent of such tax to cover the vendors expense in the collection and remittance of such tax b before the twentieth day of each month every retailer shall make a return to the director of finance for the preceding calendar month and remit an amount equivalent to the current sales tax rate on such sales to the director of finance less one and onethird percent of such tax to cover the vendors expense in the collection and remittance of such tax such returns of the taxpayer or his duly authorized agent shall contain such information and shall be made in such manner and upon such forms as the director of finance may prescribe the director of finance may extend the time for making returns and paying the taxes due under such reasonable rules and regulations as he may prescribe but no such extension shall be for a greater period than is provided in section 929 the burden of proving that any retailer is exempt from collecting the tax or from making such returns shall be on the retailer or vendor under such reasonable requirements of proof as the director of finance may prescribe c sales tax returns not received or postmarked by the twentieth of the month in which they are due and payable shall be declared delinquent and shall be subject to a penalty and an interest charges as per section 937 and section 938 d if any amount of sales or use tax is not paid on or before the last date prescribed for payment interest on such amount at the rate imposed under section 937c shall be paid for the period from such last date to the date paid the last date prescribed for payment shall be determined without regard to any extension of time for payment and shall be determined without regard to any notice and demand for payment issued by reason of jeopardy prior to the last date otherwise prescribed for such payment shall be deemed to be the date the liability for the tax arises and in no event shall it be later than the date notice and demand for the tax is made by the director of finance e interest prescribed under section 928 shall be paid upon notice and demand and shall be assessed collected and paid in the same manner as the tax to which it is applicable f if any portion of a tax is satisfied by credit of an overpayment then no interest shall be imposed under this section on the portion of the tax so satisfied for any period during which if the credit had not been made interest would have been allowed with respect to such overpayment g interest prescribed under section 928 on any sales or use tax may be assessed and collected at any time during the period within which the tax to which such interest relates may be assessed and collected h two percent of the tax collected in accordance with section 928a above shall be transferred by the city to the chamber of commerce or other nonprofit organization for purposes reasonably related to the enhancement of retail sales within the city as may be authorized by the city council pursuant to subsequent ordinance resolution or contract the city may contract with the chamber of commerce or other nonprofit organization for the administration of this fund in a manner that will best promote the purposes for which this fund is intended   art 2  4       acceptance of reports on other than monthly basis a if the accounting methods regularly employed by a vendor in the transaction of such business or other conditions are such that reports of sale made on a calendar month basis impose unnecessary hardship the director of finance upon written request of the vendor may accept reports at such intervals as will in his opinion better suit the convenience of the taxpayer and will not jeopardize the collection of the tax  provided that the director of finance may by rule permit taxpayers whose monthly tax collected is less than ten dollars to make returns and pay taxes at intervals not greater than every three months b if any vendor has been granted permission to file reports and pay tax on other than a monthly basis and shall become delinquent the permission may be revoked by the director of finance at any time immediately following notice of such revocation the vendor will be required to file reports and pay tax interest and penalties on a monthly basis c applications for permission to file reports and pay tax on a quarterly basis if approved shall take effect on the first day of the next calendar quarter which begins at least fifteen days after the date of approval until such effective date reports must be made on the monthly basis    single returns for business with multiple locations and flea markets bazaars and fairs a retailer doing business in two or more locations or places taxable under this article may file one return covering all such business activities engaged in within the city the operator of a flea market bazaar or fair shall obtain a sales tax license and shall report and remit to the city the city sales taxes collected by flea market sellers and vendors at bazaars and fairs on such form as shall be provided by the director of finance  however flea market sellers or vendors at bazaars and fairs who have a current city sales tax license shall be allowed to remit their taxes under their current license provided the same is reported to the operator of the flea market bazaar or fair  1991 statements etc of assumption by retailer it shall be unlawful for any retailer to advertise hold out or state to the public or to any consumer directly or indirectly that the tax or any part thereof imposed by this article will be assumed or absorbed by the retailer or that it will not be added to the selling price of the property sold or if added that any part thereof will be refunded a vendor who sells malt vinous or spirituous liquors by the drink shall at the time of making his first retail sale of such beverage elect either of the following methods to impose the tax a the tax may be included in the price of the drink  or b the tax may be separately stated and added to the price of the drink the vendor may elect to operate under method a for drinks sold at the bar and method b for drinks sold at tables or he may elect to operate under the same method for drinks sold at the bar and tables once having made the election he must continue to collect the tax in the manner elected unless permission to change the election is first obtained from the director of finance if the vendor elects to use different methods on bar and tables sales he must keep adequate records if the vendor elects to include the tax on the price of the drink the following method must be used to determine taxable sales exempt sales are deducted from gross sales and the difference is divided by the total of one hundred percent plus the applicable sales tax percentage vendors dispensing liquor wine or beer by the drink who purchase ingredients which they use in mixing the drink are not required to pay sales tax on the purchase of such ingredients    credit sales whenever an article is sold under a conditional sales contract whereby the seller retains title as security for all or part of the purchase price or whenever the seller takes a chattel mortgage on the article to secure all or part of the purchase price the total tax based on the total selling price shall become immediately due and payable this tax shall be charged and collected by the seller no refund or credit shall be allowed to either party to the transaction in case of repossession  remittance of excess collections if any vendor during the reporting period collects as a tax an amount in excess of the current sales tax rate on his total taxable sales he shall remit to the director of finance the full net amount of such tax and show such excess the retention by the retailer or vendor of any excess tax collections over the current sales tax rate on the total taxable sales of the retailer or vendor or the intentional failure to remit punctually to the director of finance the full amount required to be remitted by the provisions of this article is hereby declared to be a violation of this article    refunds and creditswhen allowed  conditions such refund shall be made by the director of finance after compliance with the following conditions 1 applications for refund must be made within sixty days after the purchase of the goods on which an exemption is claimed 2 applications must be supported by the affidavit of the purchaser accompanied by the original paid invoice or sales receipt and certificate issued by the seller 3 application must be made upon such forms as shall be prescribed and shall contain such information as the director of finance shall prescribe upon receipt of such application the director of finance shall examine it with all due speed and shall give notice to the applicant by order in writing of his decision thereon aggrieved applicants within ten days after such decision is mailed to them may petition the any other person to make a false statement in connection with such application b a refund shall be made or a credit allowed for the tax paid in error or by mistake such refund shall be made by the director of finance after compliance with the following conditions 1 applications for refund must be made within three years after the date of purchase of the goods for which the refund is claimed 2 applications must be supported by the affidavit of the purchaser accompanied by the original paid invoice or sales receipt and certificate issued by the seller 3 application must be made upon such forms as shall be prescribed and shall contain such information as the director of finance shall prescribe upon receipt of such application the director of finance shall examine it with all due speed and shall give notice to the applicant by order in writing of his decision thereon aggrieved applicants within ten days after such decision is mailed to them may petition the director of finance for a hearing on the claim in the manner provided in sections 946 and 948 the right of any person to a refund under this section shall not be assignable and such application for refund must be made by the same person who purchased the goods and paid the tax thereon as shown in the invoice of the sale thereof it shall be unlawful for any applicant for refund under the provisions of this section or any other person to make a false statement in connection with such application c sales taxcredit for sales or use taxes previously paid to another municipality for transactions consummated on or after  the citys sales tax shall not apply to the sale of tangible personal property at retail or the furnishing of services if the transaction was previously subjected to a sales or use tax lawfully imposed on the purchaser or user by another statutory or home rule municipality located within the state equal to or in excess of the current sales tax rate a credit shall be granted against the citys sales tax with respect to such transaction equal in amount to the lawfully imposed local sales or use tax previously paid by the purchaser or user to the previous statutory or home rule municipality the amount of the credit shall not exceed the current cortez city sales tax rate d claims for recovery the intent of this section is to streamline and standardize procedures related to situations where tax has been remitted to the incorrect municipality it is not intended to reduce or eliminate the responsibilities of the taxpayer or vendor to correctly pay collect and remit sales and use taxes to the city 1 as used herein claim for recovery means a claim for reimbursement of sales and use taxes paid to the wrong taxing jurisdiction 2 when it is determined by the director of finance of the city that sales and use tax owed to the city has been reported and paid to another municipality the city shall promptly notify the vendor that taxes are being improperly collected and remitted and that as of the date of the notice the vendor must cease improper tax collections and remittances 3 the city may make a written claim for recovery directly to the municipality that received tax andor penalty and interest owed to the city or in the alternative may institute procedures for collection of the tax from the taxpayer or vendor the decision to make a claim for recovery lies in the sole discretion of the city any claim for recovery shall include a properly executed release of claim from the taxpayer andor vendor releasing its claim to the taxes paid to the wrong municipality evidence to substantiate the claim and a request that the municipality approve or deny in whole or in part the claim within ninety days of its receipt the municipality to which the city submits a claim for recovery may for good cause request an extension of time to investigate the claim and approval of such extension by the city shall not be unreasonably withheld 4 within ninety days after receipt of a claim for recovery the city shall verify to its satisfaction whether or not all or a portion of the tax claimed was improperly received and shall notify the municipality submitting the claim in writing that the claim is either approved or denied in whole or in part including the reason for the decision if the claim is approved in whole or in part the city shall remit the undisputed amount to the municipality submitting the claim within thirty days of approval if a claim is submitted jointly by a municipality and a vendor or taxpayer the check shall be made to the parties jointly denial of a claim for recovery may only be made for good cause 5 the city may deny a claim on the grounds that it has previously paid a claim for recovery arising out of an audit of the same taxpayer 6 the period subject to a claim for recovery shall be limited to the thirtysix month period prior to the date the municipality that was wrongly paid the tax receives the claim for recovery art 2  5   part examination of returns generally  refund of excess  payment of deficiency and interest a as soon as practicable after the return is filed the director of finance shall examine it if it appears that the correct amount of tax to be remitted is greater or less than that shown in the return to be due the tax shall be recomputed b if the amount paid exceeds that which is due the excess shall be refunded or credited against any subsequent remittance from such persons c if the amount paid is less than the amount due the difference together with interest thereon at a rate established by the state commissioner of banking pursuant to section 39211105 crs from the time the return was due shall be paid by the vendor ten days after written notice and demand to him from the director of finance art 2  6 penalties for deficiencies generally a when due to negligence or intentional disregard if any part of the deficiency referred to in section 937 is due to negligence or intentional disregard of authorized rules and regulations with knowledge thereof but without intent to defraud there shall be added a penalty equal to the sum of fifteen dollars for such failure or ten percent thereof and interest on such delinquent taxes at the rate imposed under subsection c of this section plus onehalf percent per month from the date when due not exceeding eighteen percent in the aggregate such interest and addition shall become due and payable ten days after written notice and demand to him by the director of finance b if any part of the deficiency is due to fraud with the intent to evade the tax there shall be added one hundred percent of the total amount of the deficiency and in such case the whole amount of the tax unpaid including the additions shall become due and payable ten days after written notice and demand by the director of finance and an additional three percent per month on the amount shall be added from the date the return was due until paid c the annual rate of interest on delinquent taxes under subsections a and b of this section shall be that established by the state commissioner of banking pursuant to section 39211105 crs art 2  7 investigations and of finance or his duly authorized agent  tax liens generally a priority generally the tax imposed by this article shall be a first and prior lien upon the goods and business fixtures of or used by any over other liens or claims of whatsoever kind or nature b withholding of purchase money any retailer who sells out his business or stock of goods or quits business shall be required to make out the return as provided in this article within ten days after the date he sold his business or stock of goods or quit business and his successor in business shall be required to withhold a sufficient sum of the purchase money to cover the amount of such taxes due and unpaid until such time as the former owner produces a receipt from the director of finance showing that the taxes have been paid or a certificate that no taxes are due if the purchaser of a business or stock of goods fails to withhold the purchase money as above provided and the taxes are due and unpaid after the tenday period allowed he as well as the vendor shall be personally liable for the payment of the taxes unpaid by the former owner likewise anyone who takes any stock of goods or business fixtures of or used by any retailer under lease titleretaining contract or other contract arrangement by purchase foreclosure sale or otherwise takes such subject to the lien for any delinquent sales tax owed by such merchant and shall be liable for the payment of all delinquent sales taxes of such prior owner not however exceeding the value of property so taken or so acquired c priority in case of receivership etc all taxes penalties and interest imposed by this article and for which such retailer is in any way liable under the terms of this article shall be a prior and preferred claim against all the and 39211165 crs as amended d sales by sheriff etc no sheriff lessor assignee or other officer shall sell the property of any person subject to this article under process or order of any court without to be held in trust for city all sums of money paid by the purchaser to the retailer as taxes imposed by this article shall be and remain public money the property of the director of finance in the hands of such retailer and he shall hold such money in trust for the sole use and benefit of the city until paid to the director of finance as provided by this article it shall be unlawful for a retailer to fail to pay such tax to the director of finance b estimation and assessment where returns not made if any person neglects or refuses to make a return in payment of the tax required by this article the director of finance shall make an estimate based on such information as may be available as to the amount of taxes due for the period or periods for which the taxpayer is delinquent and upon the basis of such estimated amount compute and assess in addition thereto a penalty equal to the sum of fifteen dollars for such failure or ten percent thereof and interest on such delinquent taxes at the rate imposed under subsection i of this section plus onehalf percent per month from the date when due not exceeding eighteen percent in the aggregate promptly thereafter the director of finance shall give to the delinquent taxpayer written notice of such estimated taxes penalty and interest which notice must be served personally or by registered or certified mail such estimate shall thereupon become an assessment which shall become final and due and payable from such taxpayer to the director of finance ten days from the date of service of the notice or the date of mailing by registered or certified mail  provided that within such tenday period such delinquent taxpayer may petition the director of finance for a revision or modification of such assessment and shall within such tenday period furnish the director of finance with the facts and correct figures showing the correct amount of such taxes such petition shall be in writing the facts and figures shall be submitted either in writing or orally and shall be given under oath of such taxpayer thereupon the director of finance shall modify such assessment in accordance with the facts submitted which facts he deems correct such assessment shall be considered the final order of the director of finance and may be reviewed under rule 106a4 of the colorado rules of civil procedure as provided in this article  provided that the taxpayer gives written notice to the director of finance of such intention within five days after receipt of the final order of assessment c notice and imposition of tax lien if any taxes penalty or interest imposed by this article and shown due by returns filed by the taxpayer or as shown by assessments duly made as provided by this article are not paid within five days after such are due the director of finance shall issue a notice setting forth the name of the taxpayer the amount of the tax penalties and interest the date of the accrual thereof and that the city claims a first and prior lien therefor on the real and tangible personal property of a taxpayer other than the goods stock in trade and business fixtures of such taxpayer such notice shall be on forms prepared by the director of finance and shall be verified by him or his duly qualified deputy or any duly qualified agent of the director of finance whose duties are the collection of such tax and may be filed in the office of the clerk and recorder of any county in this state in which the tax payer owns real or tangible personal property the filing of such notice shall create such lien on such property in that county and constitute a notice thereof after such notice has been filed or concurrently therewith or at any time when taxes due are unpaid whether such notice is filed or not the director of finance may issue a warrant directed to any duly authorized revenue collector or to the sheriff of any county in this state commanding him to levy upon seize and sell a sufficient amount of the real and personal property of the tax debtor found within his county for the payment of the amount due together with interest penalties and costs as now or hereafter provided by ordinance subject to valid preexisting claims or liens as above provided d levy and sale of property by sheriff etc such revenue collector or sheriff shall levy upon a sufficient amount of the property of the taxcredit for sales or use tax previously paid to another municipality for transactions consummated on or after  the citys use tax shall not apply to the storage use or consumption of any article of tangible personal property the sale or use of which has already been subjected to a sales or use tax of another statutory or home rule municipality within the state legally imposed on the purchaser or user equal to or in excess of the current use tax a credit shall be granted against the citys use tax with respect to the persons storage use or consumption in the city of tangible personal property the amount of the credit to equal the tax paid by him by reason of the imposition of a sale or use tax of the previous statutory or home rule municipality on his purchase or use of the property the amount of the credit shall not exceed the current use tax rate art 3  2 a  intercity claims for recovery the intent of this section is to streamline and standardize procedures related to situations where tax has been remitted to the incorrect municipality it is not intended to reduce or eliminate the responsibilities of the taxpayer or vendor to correctly pay collect and remit sales and use taxes to the city a as used herein claim for recovery means a claim for reimbursement of sales and use taxes paid to the wrong taxing jurisdiction b when it is determined by the director of finance of the city that sales and use tax owed to the city has been reported and paid to another municipality the city shall promptly notify the vendor that taxes are being improperly collected and remitted and that as of the date of the notice the vendor must cease improper tax collections and remittances c the city may make a written claim for recovery directly to the municipality that received tax andor penalty and interest owed to the city or in the alternative may institute procedures for collection of the tax from the taxpayer or vendor the decision to make a claim for a recovery lies in the sole discretion of the city any claim for recovery shall include a properly executed release of claim from the taxpayer andor vendor releasing its claim to the taxes paid to the wrong municipality evidence to substantiate the claim and a request that the municipality approve or deny in whole or in part the claim within ninety days of its receipt the municipality to which the city submits a claim for recovery may for good cause request an extension of time to investigate the claim and approval of such extension by the city shall not be unreasonably withheld d within ninety days after receipt of a claim for recovery the city shall verify to its satisfaction whether or not all or a portion of the tax claimed was improperly received and shall notify the municipality submitting the claim in writing that the claim is either approved or denied in whole or in part including the reason for the decision if the claim is approved in whole or in part the city shall remit the undisputed amount to the municipality submitting the claim within thirty days of approval if a claim is submitted jointly by a municipality and a vendor or taxpayer the check shall be made to the parties jointly denial of a claim for recovery may only be made for good cause e the city may deny a claim on the grounds that it has previously paid a claim for recovery arising out of an audit of the same taxpayer f the period subject to a claim for recovery shall be limited to the thirtysix month period prior to the date the municipality that was wrongly paid the tax receives the claim for recovery  part payment of tax on motor vehicles or trailers any resident who purchases any motor vehicle trailer or semitrailer whether new or used outside the corporate limits of the city for use within this city shall immediately and prior to registering and obtaining a license therefor make a return showing such transaction to the director of finance and thereupon pay to him the use tax applicable thereto as provided in this article failure to do so shall constitute a violation of this article all such motor vehicles trailers or semitrailers purchased outside the corporate limits of the city for use in this city shall be registered with the county clerk and recorder of the county any person who registers any such motor vehicle trailer or semitrailer in any other country in this state or elsewhere shall be deemed in violation of this article and any such registration shall constitute prima facie evidence of an attempt to evade payment of such tax  a  building materials and supplies any person equipment a construction equipment which is located within the boundaries of the city for a period of more than thirty consecutive days shall be subject to the full applicable use tax of the city b with respect to transactions consummated on or after  construction equipment which is located within the boundaries of the city for a period of thirty consecutive days or less shall be subjected to the citys use tax in an amount which does not exceed the amount calculated as follows the purchase price of the equipment shall be multiplied by a fraction the numerator of which is one and the denominator of which is twelve and the result shall be multiplied by the current use tax rate c where the provisions of subsection b of this section are utilized the credit provisions of section 957 shall apply at such time as the aggregate sales and use taxes legally imposed by and paid to other statutory and home rule municipalities on any such equipment equal the current use tax rate d in order to avail himself of the provisions of subsection b of this section the taxpayer shall comply with the following procedure 1 prior to or on the date the equipment is located within the boundaries of the city the taxpayer shall file with the city finance director an equipment declaration on a form provided by the city such declaration shall state the dates on which the taxpayer anticipates the equipment will be located within and removed from the boundaries of the city shall include a description of each such anticipated piece of equipment and shall include such other information as is reasonably deemed necessary by the city 2 the taxpayer shall file with the city an amended equipment declaration reflecting any changes in the information contained in any previous equipment declaration no less than once every ninety days after the equipment is brought into the boundaries of the city or for equipment which is brought into the boundaries of the city for a project of less than ninety days duration no later than ten days after substantial completion of the project 3 the taxpayer need not report on any equipment declaration any equipment for which the purchase price was under two thousand five hundred dollars e if the equipment declaration is given as provided in subsection d of this section then as to any item of construction equipment for which the customary purchase price is under two thousand five hundred dollars which was brought into the boundaries of the city temporarily for use on a construction project it shall be presumed that the item was purchased in a jurisdiction having a local sales or use tax as high as the current use tax rate and that such local sales or use tax was previously paid in such case the burden of proof in any proceeding before the city the executive director of the department of revenue or the district court shall be on the city to prove such local sales or use tax was not paid f if the taxpayer fails to comply with the provisions of subsection d of this section the taxpayer may not avail himself of the provisions of subsection b of this section and shall be subject to the provisions of subsection a of this section however substantial compliance with the provisions of subsection d of this section shall allow the taxpayer to avail himself of the provisions of subsection b of this section g if the refuse and weeds as to health and sanitation generally see ch 14 of this to plumbing generally see ch 21 as to sewers generally see ch 23 in general definitions for the purposes of this chapter the following words and phrases shall have the meanings respectively ascribed to them by this section garbage all offal waste matter or vegetable matter from a kitchen market or store and other worthless offensive or filthy material and every refuse accumulation of animal fruit or vegetable matter liquid or otherwise that attends to the preparation use cooking dealing in or storing meat fish fowl fruit or vegetables junk is defined to be any old used or secondhand materials of any kind including without limitation cloth rags clothing paper rubbish bottles rubber iron tires brass copper or other metal furniture refrigerators freezers all other appliances parts of used motor vehicles machines apparatuses contrivances and parts thereof any used building materials boards or other lumber cement blocks bricks or brick bats or other secondhand building materials or any discarded abandoned or inoperable machinery tractors trucks or automobiles or any other article or thing commonly known and classified as junk rubbish house dirt ashes rags abandoned articles of clothing or similar substances trash all bottles tin cans refuse paper fallen tree limbs and all other forms of discarded refuse weed any unsightly useless troublesome or injurious herbaceous plant including any rank vegetable growth    accumulation of weeds trash etc prohibited it shall be unlawful for any owner tenant or person in possession or their agents of any lot block or parcel of ground within the city to allow or permit weeds to grow or remain when grown on such lot block or parcel of ground or along any street adjoining the same and to the middle of the alley behind the same or to allow or permit any trash junk rubbish or garbage upon such private property to the middle of the alley abutting such property or along or upon any street adjoining the same  exceptions this chapter shall not apply to garbage or waste material properly deposited in containers for removal as provided by the regulations of the city sanitation district nor shall it apply to any junk as that term is herein defined which is properly stored by the property owner in a shed or garage or other building suitable for that purpose and not exposed to public view  removal of garbage refuse and weeds abatementissuance of noticemunicipal complaint whenever an informal complaint is made to the police or to any other appropriate city official or member of the city council regarding an alleged violation of this chapter or whenever any police officer or city employee observes an apparent violation of this chapter written notice shall be served upon the person in possession or the owner of the real property upon which such violation is located such notice shall inform such person of the violation and direct that he take action within ten days after receipt of such notice to comply with this section or prosecution will be commenced for the violation in the municipal court subsequent filing in the municipal court shall not require ten days notice if the person in possession or owner has received prior notice during the calendar year filing in the municipal court does not preclude the city from taking such action as set forth in section 126 and subsequent sections of this code to collect any and all costs that it may have for abating the violation the city manager or his designated city employee is authorized to give notice to any property owner or if the same cannot be found to any tenant in possession or any agent of the tenant or owner if known whose property is being kept or maintained contrary to this chapter and such notice may be deposited by mail in the city post office addressed to the record owner or owners or tenant or agent as the case may be and if such owner cannot be found the notice may be given by posting the property and the notice shall state that if the weeds rubbish trash junk or garbage are not removed from such premises on or before ten days from the date of such notice the same may be done by the city and the cost thereof including the cost of inspection and other incidental costs in connection therewith will be assessed against such real property the notice shall also state that the owners failure to comply will result in misdemeanor charges being filed against the owner in the municipal court and the possible penalties therefor assessment notice file a written objection thereto with the city clerk who shall thereupon designate the next regular meeting of the city council as the date when such objection may be heard the spurge are declared to be undesirable plants to be controlled in accordance with this section b declaration of nuisance leafy spurge russian knapweed and diffuse knapweed spotted knapweed and diffuse
