the application the local or the state licensing authority denied an application for the same class of license due to the nature of the use or other concern related to the location f the cortez city clerk shall not accept or act upon an application for a retail marijuana license if the proposed location fails to comply with the distance requirements as set forth in section 15312 distance requirements now in effect or as may be amended from time to time excepting when an operatorowner has a licensed dispensary and retail marijuana establishment at the same physical location whether located within or outside the corporate limits of the city     renewal  fee each local approval issued pursuant to this chapter shall be valid for a period of one year from the date of issuance and may be renewed as provided in this section a an existing retail marijuana operation shall file an application for renewal with the city clerk not less than fortyfive days prior to the date of expiration the application shall be accompanied by a renewal operating fee in an amount set by the city council the city clerk will accept late applications not more than ninety days after the date of expiration upon payment of a five hundred dollar late application of approval fee the city clerk will not in any circumstances accept renewal applications more than ninety days after the date of expiration b the approval may be renewed by as a council action item unless it appears to the city clerk or other city staff that grounds exist to deny the renewal application in which case the city clerk shall refer the application to the city council for review at a public hearing c no local approval shall be issued until the applicant produces a license issued and granted by the state licensing authority covering the period for which the renewal is sought d no approval shall be issued unless and until a renewal applicant is current in payment of all city sales tax other fees assessed in accordance with section 15409 above and any other fees assessed upon applicant by the city   investigation of applicant a upon receipt of an application for approval under this article the city clerk shall transmit copies of the application and attachments to the chief of police the city manager the planning and building department the city attorney and any other person or agency who the city clerk determines should participate in the review of the application the city or any of its departments or officials may visit and inspect the plant or property in which the applicant proposes to conduct business and investigate the fitness to conduct such business of any person or the officers and directors of any corporation or the partners of any partnership applying for a license b in investigating the fitness of the applicant the city shall obtain criminal history record information furnished by a criminal justice agency subject to any restrictions imposed by such agency in the event the local licensing authority takes into consideration information concerning the applicants criminal history record the local licensing authority shall also consider any information provided by the applicant regarding such criminal history record including but not limited to evidence of rehabilitation character references and educational achievements especially those items pertaining to the period of time between the applicants last criminal conviction and the consideration of the application for a license c not less than five days prior to the date of the public hearing on a license application or in the event of an application for which no public hearing is scheduled not less than five days prior to the decision whether to approve or deny an application the city clerk shall make known the findings of the investigation in writing to the applicant and other parties of interest   hearings  notice  publication a public hearings before the city council or a hearing officer appointed by the city council shall be required for the following types of applications and determinations 1 applications for a retail marijuana store or for the relocation of a retail marijuana store which shall be reviewed by the city council  2 the applications described in subsection b when the city clerk determines grounds exist for denial per subsection 15410b of this article  and 3 suspensions or revocations of any license which shall be heard by the cortez city council or a hearings officer appointed by city council 4 applications for a retail marijuana cultivation license or for the relocation of such a license  5 applications for a retail marijuana testing facility or for the relocation of such a license  and 6 all renewal applications  7 applications to modify the ownership structure of an existing licensee b in the event an application is scheduled for a public hearing the city clerk shall post and publish public notice thereof not less than ten days prior to the hearing 1 public notice given by posting shall include sign of suitable material not less than twentytwo inches wide and twentysix inches high composed of letters not less than one inch in height and stating the nature of the type of license applied for the nature of the hearing the date of the application the date of the hearing the name and address of the applicant and such other information as may be required to fully apprise the public of the nature of the application in the case of a new license application the sign shall contain the names and addresses of the officers directors or manager of the facility to be licensed the sign shall be placed on the subject premises in a location that is conspicuous and plainly visible to the general public 2 public notice given by publication shall contain the same information as that required for signs and shall be made in a newspaper of general circulation in montezuma county c at the public hearing held pursuant to this section any party in interest shall be allowed to present evidence and to crossexamine witnesses 1 party in interest means any of the following a the applicant  b an adult resident of the neighborhood under consideration  or c the owner or manager of a business located in the neighborhood under consideration 2 the city council or a hearing officer appointed by city council may limit the presentation of evidence and crossexamination so as to prevent repetitive and cumulative evidence or examination 3 nothing in this subsection shall be construed to prevent a representative of an organized neighborhood group that encompasses part or all of the neighborhood under consideration from presenting evidence subject to this section such representative shall reside within the neighborhood groups geographic boundaries and shall be a member of the neighborhood group such representative shall not be entitled to crossexamine witnesses or seek judicial review of the licensing authoritys decision   persons prohibited as licensees a no license approval provided by this article shall be issued to or held by 1 any person whose criminal history indicates the person is not of good moral character  2 any corporation any of whose officers directors or stockholders criminal histories indicate such person is not of good moral character  3 any partnership association or company any of whose officers or any of whose members criminal histories indicate such person is not of good moral character  4 any person employing assisted by or financed in whole or in part by any other person whose criminal history indicates such person is not of good moral character or who is not a resident of colorado  5 any cooperative association any of whose officers directors or stockholders or members criminal histories indicate that such person is not of good moral character  6 a person under twentyone years of age  7 a person approved pursuant to this article who during a period of licensure or approval or who at the time of application has failed to a provide surety bond or file any tax return with a taxing agency relating to the operation of a retail marijuana establishment  b pay any taxes interest or penalties due to a taxing agency relating to the operation of a retail marijuana establishment 8 a person who has discharged a sentence in the five years immediately preceding the application date for a conviction of a felony or a person who has discharged a sentence for a conviction of a felony pursuant to any state or federal law regarding the possession distribution manufacturing cultivation or use of a controlled substance in the ten years immediately preceding his or her application date or five years from the effective date of hb 1317 enacted in 201 whichever is longer  except that the local licensing authority may grant a license to a person if the person has a state felony conviction based on possession or use of marijuana or marijuana concentrate that would not be a felony if the person were convicted of the offense on the date he or she applied for licensure  9 a person who employs another person at a retail marijuana establishment who has not submitted fingerprints for a criminal history record check or whose criminal record history check reveals that the person is ineligible  10 a sheriff deputy sheriff police officer or prosecuting officer or an officer or employee of the state licensing authority or a local licensing authority  11 a person for a location that is currently licensed as a retail food establishment or wholesale food establishment  or 12 a person who has not been a resident of colorado for at least two years prior to the date of the persons application b in making a determination as to character or when considering the conviction of a crime the local licensing authority shall be governed by the provisions of crs  245101 c the focus of the inquiry into the character of any person associated with the operation of a retail marijuana business shall be whether the persons character is such that violations of state law or city ordinances pertaining to the possession and distribution of marijuana andor the operation of retail marijuana establishments would be likely to result if a license were granted   issuance or denial of approval a in determining whether to issue an approval under this article the city council may consider the following 1 whether the application is complete and signed by the applicant  2 whether the applicant has paid the application fee  3 whether the application complies with all the requirements of this article the colorado retail marijuana rules promulgated by the state licensing authority  4 whether the application contains any material misrepresentations  5 whether the proposed retail marijuana establishment complies with applicable zoning regulations the local licensing authority shall make specific findings of fact with respect to whether the building in which the proposed medical marijuana business will be located conforms to the distance requirements set forth in the applicable use criteria  6 the facts and evidence adduced as a result of its investigation as well as any other facts and any other pertinent matters affecting the qualifications of the applicant for the conduct of the type of business proposed  7 any other facts pertinent to the type of license approval for which application has been made including the number type and availability of retail marijuana outlets located in or near the premises under consideration  and 8 for applications to approve any retail marijuana store in the same location where any medical marijuana center or retail marijuana store is or has previously been licensed evidence that the licensed premises have been previously operated in a manner that adversely affects the public health welfare or safety of the immediate neighborhood in which the establishment is located 9 is the applicant current in payment to the city of cortez all taxes fees sales tax assessments or charges under section 15409d above b the city council may deny the approval application for good cause as defined in the colorado retail marijuana c the city council may impose reasonable conditions upon any license approval issued pursuant to this article d retail cultivation approvals shall not be subject to this limit if the licensee holds or has successfully applied for a retail marijuana store license in the case of multiple applications for an available license the city clerk shall publish the availability of the license and assign priority by lot to each completed application received within fortyfive days of the date of publication e no person shall own operate manage control or hold any interest in more than one retail sales marijuana establishment in the city f within thirty days after the public hearing or completion of the application investigation the local licensing authority shall issue its decision approving or denying the application the decision shall be in writing shall state the reasons for the decision and a copy of the decision shall be mailed by certified mail to the applicant at the address shown on the application g the city clerk shall not issue certificate of approval nor notify the state licensing authority of an approval until the building in which the business to be conducted has been issued a certificate of occupancy and is in compliance with the architects drawing plot plan and detailed sketch for the interior of the building submitted with the application and all state and city laws rules and regulations now in effect or as may be adopted or amended from time to time h after approval the local licensing authority shall notify the state licensing authority of such approval and issue to the successful applicant a certificate of local approval   contents and display of approval the approved licensee shall post the certificate approval in a conspicuous location on the premises a retail marijuana establishment approval shall contain the following information a type of approval  b the name of the licensee  c the date of issuance of the approval  d the street address at which the licensee is authorized to operate the retail marijuana establishment  e any conditions of approval imposed upon the license by the city council  f the date of expiration of the approval  and g the signature of the city clerk   transferchanges in ownership structure a license approvals held by natural persons may not be transferred in the event a natural person or persons holding a license sell the associated retail marijuana establishment the purchaser shall be entitled to apply for a new retail marijuana establishment license for the purchased business notwithstanding the provisions of subsection 15414f if the proposed sale or conveyance of a partial interest in the retail marijuana establishment to a person who previously did not own ten percent or more of the retail marijuana establishment will after the sale result in that person owning ten percent or more of the retail marijuana establishment the licensee shall apply for a change in ownership structure which the local licensing authority shall process as a new license approval application by the new owner b license approvals held by partnerships corporations limited liability companies or other business entities are not transferable and terminate automatically upon dissolution of the entity if the proposed sale or conveyance of any interest in the entity to a person who previously did not own ten percent or more of the business will after the sale result in the person owning ten percent or more of the entity the licensee shall apply for a change in ownership structure which the local licensing authority shall process as a new license approval application by the new owner c changes in ownership structure that do not result in a person increasing that persons interest from less than ten percent to more than ten percent shall be reported to the local licensing authority and may be approved administratively by the city clerk   suspension or revocation a a license approval issued pursuant to this article may be suspended or revoked by the city council or a hearing officer appointed by the city council after a hearing for the following reasons 1 fraud misrepresentation or a false statement of material fact contained in the permit application  2 any violation of city ordinance or state law pertaining to the operation of a retail marijuana establishment or a medical marijuana business including regulations adopted by the state licensing authority for the possession or distribution of marijuana  3 a violation of any of the terms and conditions of the license  4 a violation of any of the provisions of this chapter b in deciding whether a license approval should be suspended or revoked and in deciding whether to impose conditions in the event of a suspension the local licensing authority shall consider 1 the nature and severity of the violation  2 corrective action if any taken by the licensee  3 prior violations if any by the licensee  4 the likelihood of recurrence of the violation  5 the circumstances of the violation  6 whether the violation was willful  and 7 previous sanctions if any imposed on the licensee c the provisions of of the colorado retail marijuana govern proceedings for the suspension or revocation of a license approval issued hereunder d the city council or the hearings officer may impose a fine in lieu of a suspension in accordance with the provisions of the colorado retail marijuana   change of location a a licensee may move his or her permanent location to another location in the city but it shall be unlawful to cultivate manufacture distribute or sell retail marijuana at any such place until permission to do so is granted by the city and the state licensing authority b in permitting a change of location the city council shall consider all reasonable restrictions that are or may be placed on the new location and any such new location shall comply with all requirements of this article the city of cortez land use the colorado retail marijuana rules promulgated by the state licensing authority c the local licensing authority shall not authorize a change of location until the applicant produces a license issued and granted by the state licensing authority covering the period for which the change of location is sought   operational requirements retail marijuana establishments shall comply with the following operational requirements a retail marijuana establishments shall provide customers with contact information for local drug abuse treatment centers as well as educational materials regarding the hazards of substance abuse b retail marijuana stores shall operate only during the hours of  am to  pm c retail marijuana establishments shall provide adequate security on the business premises which shall include the following 1 twentyfour hour security surveillance cameras to facilitate the investigation of crimes and to include video and audio capabilities with a redundant power supply and circuitry to monitor entrancesexits and parking lot along with the interior and exterior of the premises security video and audio shall be preserved for forty five days the owner shall provide segments of surveillance footage upon request to law enforcement officers investigating crimes committed against the establishment or its customers the owner shall be required to produce surveillance footage disclosing the identity of customers and shall not edit surveillance footage to protect customer privacy the resolution of these color cameras shall be of sufficient quality to allow for the identification of the subjects facial features in all lighting conditions in the event of a crime  2 a burglar fire alarm system that is professionally monitored and maintained in good working order  a locking safe permanently affixed to the premises suitable for storage of inventory and cash all to be stored during nonbusiness hours live plants being cultivated shall not be deemed inventory requiring storage in a locked safe  3 exterior lighting that illuminates the exterior walls of the establishment and that complies with the lighting code set forth in this city of cortez land use d no firearms knives or other weapons shall be permitted in a retail marijuana store except those carried by sworn peace officers e marijuana shall not be consumed or used on the premises of a retail marijuana store and it shall be unlawful for a retail marijuana store licensee to allow marijuana to be consumed upon its licensed premises in the case of a retail marijuana store located in a structure with a legal secondary unit or other legal dwelling unit the dwelling unit shall not be considered part of the retail marijuana store premises if access to the dwelling unit is prohibited to the retail marijuana store customers f retail marijuana establishments shall comply with the provisions of the colorado retail marijuana rules promulgated by the state licensing authority and with any other relevant colorado statute or administrative regulation g retail marijuana stores shall produce such quantities of product sold as required by the applicable state statutes rules and regulations regarding cultivation of product sold now in effect or as may be amended from time to time h the chief of police or other appropriate city department head shall report to the city clerk all violations of this article and other applicable state and local laws and the city clerk shall maintain a record for each license issued and record the reports of the violations there i immediately upon receipt from the state licensing authority the licensee owner or manager shall provide the city clerk with a photo copy of any and all state badges or other form of official identification issued to owners operators managers or employees of any retail marijuana establishment in the city of cortez       penalty a violation of this article shall be punishable as set forth in section 1716a cortez city in effect or as may be amended from time to time   chapter 15a  mobile homes as to licensing of mobile home parks see  1587 to 1590 as to fire fire prevention generally see ch 10 as to building standards and buildings generally see ch 6 in general secs 15a1 to 15a5  reserved regulations and minimum standards for location of mobile homes on single sites it shall be unlawful for any person to locate a mobile home on any single lot for the purpose of occupancy without first applying for and securing a building permit from the city  blocking diagram required the request for a building permit shall be accompanied by a blocking diagram supplied by the manufacturer of the mobile home for the model proposed for location the city may accept in lieu of such blocking diagram a complete stabilizing and tiedown system designed by a registered engineer or architect  building permit for construction required the city shall issue a building permit for the construction of foundations or stabilizing system in accordance with all of the city requirements regarding the issuance of building permits  conformance to uniform building   other requirements a in the event a permanent foundation is to be constructed the foundation shall meet all the requirements of the uniform building well as providing additional supports for the carrying frame as recommended by the units manufacturer b stabilizing devices or piers shall be installed and inspected in accordance with the support system recommended by the manufacturer or designed by the engineer or architect c ground anchors shall be installed and inspected following the application for and securing of a permit therefor unless the entire tiedown system including ground anchors is designed by a professional engineer or architect ground anchors shall be not more than twentyfour feet on centers beginning from the front line of the mobile home and not more than six feet openend spacing at the rear line of the mobile home unless additional tiedowns are installed ground anchors for diagonal ties shall be provided in conjunction with each vertical tiedown  exemptions from uniform building anything in this article to the contrary from and after  any mobile home being hereafter erected upon a foundation within the designated r4 zones of the city and which mobile home bears a certification insignia issued by the state shall be deemed to be exempt from the minimum requirements of the uniform building this city and such mobile home shall be approved by the city building inspector  minimum size no mobile home installed in accordance with this section shall have a width of less than ten feet nor a length of less than fifty feet  skirting required mobile home units not placed on permanent foundations such that all of the undercarriage and running gear are unexposed shall be skirted in a manner to so conceal said undercarriage and running gear a permit shall be applied for and issued by the city for such skirting installation shall be inspected and approved by the city  utility connections utility connections for water sanitary sewer electricity and natural gas shall be provided by no lesser standards than those stated in the preceding sections and shall be inspected and approved by the city or other appropriate agency having jurisdiction thereof  certificate of occupancy required prior to the occupancy of any mobile home on a single lot the city shall issue a certificate of occupancy which indicates that all of the requirements of the city have been met all of the procedural requirements of the city regarding certificate of occupancy shall be complied with  standards for mobile home parks inspection a it shall be the duty of the city manager to cause to be made with the assistance of the building inspector police fire and health department and the owner or his authorized agent an inspection of each park including all mobile homes b it shall be the direct responsibility of the city manager or his agent to enforce this ordinance and to issue a summons directly to the offending party  community facilities to conform to construction regulations every building or structure within a mobile home park shall be constructed in accordance with the applicable provisions of all city building and construction regulations and codes as set out in this any other ordinance of the city  lot standards a utility connections serving the mobile home shall be located to properly service the mobile home erected on the stand b mobile home utility service shall be connected to the mobile home park system by means of approved materials no rigid utility connections shall be made c no mobile home shall be permanently attached to a foundation stabilizing devices or piers may be used where specified by the manufacturer they shall be installed in accordance with his instructions d no combustible material shall be stored under any mobile home  plumbing standards a connections shall be made to the city public water supply and be made available to every lot within the park b all new water piping fixtures and other equipment shall be constructed and all existing piping fixtures and other equipment shall be maintained in accordance with local regulations and requirements and shall be of a type size and in location approved by the city c a shutoff valve located below frost line shall be provided on the water riser pipe of each mobile home lot  sewage disposal standards a connections shall be made to the city sewage collection system and be available to every lot within the park b all new sewage collection lines shall be installed in accordance with all applicable city standards and requirements as set out in this any other ordinance of the city c the sewage collection inlet for each lot shall have a nominal inside diameter of at least three inches d the lateral line from the mobile home discharge to the sewage collection line shall have a slope of at least onefourth inch per foot all joints shall be secure and watertight and the pipe shall be firmly supported to prevent deflection and movement e all materials used for sewer connections between a mobile home and the inlet shall be semirigid corrosive resistant nonabsorbent and durable the inner surface shall be smooth f provisions shall be made for plugging the sewage collection inlet with a tamperproof fitting when a mobile home does not occupy the lot surface drainage shall be diverted away from the inlet the rim of the inlet shall extend not more than four inches above ground elevation  electrical standards a all new electrical installations in mobile home parks shall be designed and constructed in accordance with state law this any other ordinance of the city b all existing electrical systems shall be maintained in a safe condition  natural or liquefied petroleum gas system standards a gas equipment and installations within a mobile home park shall be designed in accordance with this any other ordinance of the city b all new gas piping installed below ground shall have a minimum cover of eighteen inches c each mobile home lot shall have an approved gas shutoff valve installed upstream of the mobile home lot gas outlet such valve shall be readily accessible and the location clearly labeled whenever the mobile home lot outlet is not in use the outlet shall be equipped with an approved cap or plug to prevent accidental discharge of gas d each new installation of a mobile home utilizing gas shall be connected to the mobile home lot outlet by an approved threefourths inch mobile home connection not more than six feet in length approved pipe and fittings may be used between the flexible connector and the mobile home lot gas outlet when the distance between the mobile home gas service connection exceeds that required to make a safe installation with only a mobile home connector e all gas outlets risers regulators meters valves or other exposed equipment shall be protected from mechanical damage by vehicles or other causes f the storage handling and use of liquefied petroleum gas shall be in conformity with nfpa manual d58  fire safety standards a the arrangements of lots and streets and roads of each mobile home park shall meet the approval of the chief of the fire department b fire hydrants shall be provided installed and connected to the public water system within approximately five hundred feet of all mobile home lots c there shall be no burning of rubbish or trash within the boundaries of any mobile home park d care shall be taken to maintain the park free of dry brush leaves and weeds which might communicate fires between mobile homes and other buildings in the park e permanent public buildings shall be provided with portable fire extinguishers in accordance with all city regulations f the connecting and disconnecting of all public utility services to mobile homes shall be made by qualified or authorized persons as determined by the city g owners shall not place empty liquefied petroleum gas containers under their mobile homes empty containers shall be left in place if there is more than one container if the mobile homes liquefied petroleum gas supply is limited to one container and a replacement has been secured any empty container shall be stored in the area designated for such storage h operators of vehicular equipment shall observe all posted signs and shall keep all designated fire lanes and access to fire hydrants open at all times i heat tapes shall be of a type approved by a recognized testing laboratory  removal of wheels from mobile homes in parks the removal of permanent running gear including hubs and axles from any mobile home located in a mobile home park is hereby prohibited except temporarily for the purpose of repairs the removal of rubber tires and wheels for the protection against decay shall be permitted  maintenance a all mobile home lots mobile home stands and utilities existing and new shall be maintained in a safe and sanitary condition all buildings utilities or structures which were required to have been erected or installed pursuant to any previous building code or ordinance relating to this use shall be maintained in good working order the owner shall be responsible for the maintenance of all buildings structures and utilities b no mobile home or travel trailer shall be parked or permitted to stand upon any public street highway road alley or other such rightofway for more than twentyfour hours  penalties in addition to all other penalties herein provided any person violating any of the provisions of this chapter or suffering or permitting the same to be violated shall be deemed guilty of a misdemeanor and upon conviction shall be punished as set forth in cortez city a now in effect or as may be amended from time to time the imposition of one penalty for any one violation shall not excuse the violation or permit it to continue and each day thereafter that prohibitive conditions are maintained shall constitute a separate and chargeable offense   amended by memo 3519  92512 chapter 15b  mechanical code mechanical adopted there is hereby adopted by reference as though the same were fully printed and set forth herein the international ticket with a fine of four hundred ninety nine dollars c in addition to the penalty specified above the municipal judge may order suspended fines to insure compliance and may also order the removal of said recreational vehicle or park trailer from city streets alleys and other city property by city staff d this section shall be enforceable by the cortez police department cortez officers or the city with the ground  e has an empty weight of less than one thousand eight hundred pounds  and f must be electric motor powered  regulation of nevs regulation of nevs includes the following a no person shall operate a neighborhood electric vehicle on a limited access highway b no person shall operate a neighborhood electric vehicle on any street or highway with a posted speed limit of more than thirty miles per hour provided however that neighborhood electric vehicles shall be allowed to cross at intersections streets and highways that have a posted speed limit in excess of thirty miles per hour c neighborhood electric vehicles shall not be operated at a speed in excess of twentyfive miles per hour d neighborhood electric vehicles shall not carry a greater number of persons or carry a greater load than that specified by the manufacturer the driver and all passengers must be seated in seats substantially similar to those placed in the vehicle by the manufacturer e no person shall operate a neighborhood electric vehicle on a cityowned or maintained trail f neighborhood electric vehicles shall only be operated by persons holding a valid drivers license g operators of neighborhood electric vehicles shall obey all traffic laws of the state of colorado including but not limited to laws concerning financial responsibility and all traffic laws and regulations of the united states of america  use of retarders prohibited it shall be unlawful for any person while driving any truck bus automobile or other motor vehicle to use a retarder commonly known as a jake brake have the right to a jury trial if within twenty days after arraignment or entry of plea such defendant files with the court a written jury demand and at the same time tenders to the court a jury fee right to a trial by jury for any noncriminal traffic infraction or offense except as hereinafter provided in cortez city all offenses that violate any provision of chapter 16 of the cortez city of any provision of the model traffic colorado municipalities as currently adopted or as may be amended from time to time are hereby declared to be noncriminal traffic infractions or offenses noncriminal offenses are punishable by a fine of up to four hundred ninetynine dollars only except as set forth in cortez city  c any defendant charged with violation of any of the offenses of the model traffic colorado municipalities now in effect or as may be amended from time to time listed in cortez city  d in the event that a defendant is charged with more than one traffic offense arising out of the trial request is made for a greater number not to exceed six jurors failure to designate the number of jurors to try the case shall constitute waiver of a jury in excess of three jurors upon request for a jury trial the court shall set a time and place for such trial and shall bring before the court a sufficient number of jurors for the trial of the case      for state law as to trial by jury in section 1716a cortez city may be amended from time to time part   prohibition of underage consumption of alcohol a as used in this section unless the context otherwise requires establishment means a business firm enterprise service or fraternal organization club institution entity group or residence and any real property including buildings and improvements connected therewith and shall also include any members employees and occupants associated therewith ethyl alcohol means any substance which is or contains ethyl alcohol possession of ethyl alcohol means that a person has or holds any amount of ethyl alcohol anywhere on his person or that a person owns or has custody of ethyl alcohol or has ethyl alcohol within his immediate presence and control private property means any dwelling and its curtilage which is being used by a natural person or natural persons for habitation and which is not open to the public and privately owned real property which is not open to the public private property shall not include 1 any establishment which has or is required to have a license pursuant to article 46 47 or 48 of title 12 crs  or 2 any establishment which sells ethyl alcohol or upon which ethyl alcohol is sold  or 3 any establishment which leases rents or provides accommodations to members of the public generally b 1 any person age eighteen to twenty years of age who possesses or consumes ethyl alcohol anywhere in the city of cortez commits illegal possession or consumption of ethyl alcohol by an underage person illegal possession or consumption of ethyl alcohol by an underage person is a strict liability offense 2 illegal possession or consumption of ethyl alcohol by an underage person shall be punished by a fine of not more than five hundred dollars or jail up to one hundred eighty days or both a fine and jail sentence the court upon sentencing a defendant pursuant to this subsection may in addition to any fine suspend jail time on condition that the defendant submit to and complete an alcohol evaluation or assessment an alcohol education program or an alcohol treatment program at such defendants own expense c it shall be an affirmative defense to the offense described in subsection b of this section that the ethyl alcohol was possessed or consumed by a person under twentyone years of age under the following circumstances 1 while such person was legally upon private property with the knowledge and consent of the owner or legal possessor of such private property and the ethyl alcohol was possessed or consumed with the consent of his parent or legal guardian who was present during such possession or consumption  or 2 when the existence of ethyl alcohol in a persons body was due solely to the ingestion of a confectionery which contained ethyl alcohol within the limits prescribed by section 255410 1 i ii crs  or the ingestion of any substance which was manufactured designed or intended primarily for a purpose other than oral human ingestion  or the ingestion of any substance which was manufactured designed or intended solely for medicinal or hygienic purposes  or solely from the ingestion of a beverage which contained less than onehalf of one percent of ethyl alcohol by weight 3 the person is a student who a tastes but does not imbibe an alcohol beverage only while under the direct supervision of an instructor who is at least twentyone years of age and employed by a postsecondary school  b is enrolled in a university or a postsecondary school accredited or certified by an agency recognized by the united states department of education a nationally recognized accrediting agency or association or the private occupational education act of 198 article 59 of title 12 crs  c is participating in a culinary arts food service or restaurant management degree program  and d tastes but does not imbibe the alcohol beverage for instructional purposes as a part of a required course in which the alcohol beverage except the portion the student tastes remains under the control of the instructor d the possession or consumption of ethyl alcohol shall not constitute a violation of this section if such possession or consumption takes place for religious purposes protected by the first amendment to the united states constitution an underage person and one or two other persons shall be immune from criminal prosecution under this section if they establish the following 1 one of the underage persons called 911 and reported that another underage person was in need of medical assistance due to alcohol consumption  2 the underage person who called 911 and if applicable one or two other persons acting in concert with the underage person who called 911 provided each of their names to the 911 operator  3 the underage person was the first person to make the 911 report  and 4 the underage person and if applicable one or two other persons acting in concert with the underage person who made the 911 call remained on the scene with the underage person in need of medical assistance until assistance arrived and cooperated with medical assistance and law enforcement personnel on the scene e prima facie evidence of a violation of subsection b of this section shall consist of 1 evidence that the defendant age eighteen to twenty years of age and possessed or consumed ethyl alcohol anywhere in the city of cortez  or 2 evidence that the defendant was age eighteen to twenty years of age and manifested any of the characteristics commonly associated with ethyl alcohol intoxication or impairment while charge forfeiture or penalty 2 uses false or fictitious personal identifying information to identify a specific individual such as but not limited to a name date of birth social security # official government issued drivers license or id card number 3 a violation of this section shall be punished as set forth in cortez city a now in effect or as may be amended from time to time   repealed  secs utterance gesture or display in a public place and the utterance gesture or display tends to incite an immediate breach of the peace  or 2 makes unreasonable noise in a public place or near a private residence that he has no right to occupy  or 3 fights with another in a public place except in an amateur or professional contest of athletic skill  or 4 not being a peace officer discharges a firearm in a public place except when engaged in lawful target practice or hunting  or the ritual discharge of blank ammunition cartridges as an attendee at a funeral for a deceased person who was a veteran of the armed forces of the united states  or 5 not being a peace officer displays a deadly weapon displays any article used or fashioned in a manner to cause a person to reasonably believe that the vandalism means any unauthorized inscription symbol design or configuration of letters numbers or symbols or any combination thereof written drawn scribed etched marked painted stained stuck on or adhered to any surface public or private including but not limited to trees signs poles fixtures utility boxes walls windows roofs paths walks fences streets underpasses overpasses bridges trestles buildings and any other surface or surfaces regardless of the material of the component 2 it is unlawful for any person or group of persons to commit or attempt to commit any overt act resulting in the application of graffiti or engaging in or attempting to engage in any act of related vandalism such prohibited conduct shall include but not be limited to conspiring to commit or assist in the application of graffiti or engaging in or assisting in any act of related vandalism including but not limited to acting as a look out regardless of whether the act of applying graffiti or engaging in related vandalism was actually committed or witnessed 3 graffiti or graffitirelated vandalism which appears on property or structures public or private is deemed to be a public nuisance and shall be subject to abatement as herein proved should an owner or responsible party fail to remove or otherwise abate the graffiti as required in any notice of violation served upon him the city may proceed to abate the graffiti or cause its removal and bill the owner or responsible party for the cost thereof in the event of nonpayment the city attorney shall be and is hereby authorized to take appropriate measures to create a lien against the subject property for purposes of recovering such costs together with interest as provided by applicable law if it is determined by the city that graffiti exists on property in violation of this section the city manager or his designated agent may notify the owner of the subject property or responsible party in writing issuance of a notice of violation providing a maximum of ten days within which the graffiti is to be abated or otherwise removed such notice may be served by certified mail personal service or by posting the subject property and publishing a notice thereof in a newspaper of general circulation within the city of cortez such notice shall identify the property in violation shall generally describe the location of the graffiti and shall direct that such graffiti shall be removed or otherwise abated within ten days of the receipt of the notice it is unlawful for any property owner to fail to remove or otherwise abate graffiti or related vandalism within the time frame set forth in the above notice once the same has been served 4 as part of any sentence imposed by the municipal court with respect to persons who either admit or are convicted of a violation of this section the court may as part of its sentencing order that restitution be paid to the owner or party responsible for the removal or abatement of the graffiti pursuant to subsection a3 of this section if the person found to be in violation of this section is a minor under the age of eighteen years living with his or her parents or lawful guardian or custodian the court may order restitution to be paid by the minors parents or lawfully designated guardian or custodian with respect to any minor under the age of eighteen years who admits or is convicted of the application of graffiti or any act of related vandalism on property owned by the city of cortez the city attorney shall be and is hereby authorized to seek restitution on behalf sections of said section remain valid and enforceable it being the intent that the various provisions provided for herein are severable   92512 passing bad checks a it is unlawful for any person to issue or pass a check as payment for any goods services or other thing of value or in exchange for cash when that person knew that at the time of the issuance of the check there were insufficient funds existing within the account being drawn upon to cover the check for purposes of this section the term insufficient funds means that a drawer has insufficient funds with the drawee to pay a check when the drawer has no checking account with the drawee or has funds in a checking account with a drawee in an amount less than the amount of the check plus the amount of all other checks outstanding at the time of issuance a check dishonored for no account shall also be deemed to be dishonored for insufficient funds b it is unlawful for any person to issue or pass a check as payment for any goods services or other things of value or an exchange for cash and to thereafter fail to tender sufficient funds to make the check good within fourteen days of notification from either the drawee upon which the check was drawn or from the person or firm to which the check was originally issued that the check has been twice refused for insufficient funds it shall constitute a prima facie violation of this subsection that the firm or person to which the check was originally issued 1 obtained photo identification from the drawer at the time of acceptance of the check  2 obtained an address of the drawer of the check at the time of the acceptance of the check  3 presented the check to the drawee for acceptance or refusal for the first time within thirty days of the date of issuance of the check  and 4 upon presenting the check to the drawee for collection and having twice received the check back for insufficient funds the person or firm to whom the check was originally issued shall turn the insufficient fund check over to the cortez police department for criminal prosecution c it is unlawful for any person to stop payment or cause payment to be stopped on any check issued or passed as payment for any goods services or other thing of value or in exchange for cash when that person does so with the intent to defraud d it is unlawful for any person to open a checking account negotiable order or withdrawal account or share draft account using false identification or an assumed name for the purpose of and with the intent of committing theft by check e nothing in this section shall apply where the value of the check exceeds one thousand dollars or where the offender is under accusation of formal criminal charges involving the issuance of two or more checks within any sixtyday period within the state with an aggregate value of one thousand dollars f a bank savings and loan association industrial bank or credit union shall not be civilly or criminally liable for releasing information relating to the drawers account to any police authority or officer of the court provided the release of such information is for purposes of investigating or prosecuting a potential or alleged violation of this section g in imposing a penalty for violation of this section the municipal court is specifically authorized and empowered to require restitution in full to the person or of being junked wrecked wholly or partially dismantled discarded abandoned or unable to perform the functions for which it was originally constructed permanent fence a fence of durable nature conforming to city ordinances and construction in such a manner so as to shield or conceal the area contained within the fence from public view person any person firm partnership association corporation company or organization of any kind property any real property within the city which is not a street or highway storage the use of property for the purpose of keeping a vehicle thereon which is not in use by the owner thereof or any other person it shall be prima facie evidence that a vehicle is being stored if it has not been moved from its position on the property in the sixty days previous to the date of notice of noncompliance street or highway the entire width between the boundary lines of every way publicly maintained when any part thereof is open to the use of the public for purposes of vehicular travel vehicle a machine propelled by power other than human power designed to travel on the road by using wheels treads runners or slides to transport persons or property or pull machinery and includes without limitation automobiles airplanes trucks trailers motorcycles motorscooters tractors buggies and wagons the term vehicle does not include antique vehicles as defined in this section    2 prohibited acts a from and after the effective date of the ordinance codified in this chapter it is unlawful for any person firm or corporation to park or leave standing upon any public street alley or thoroughfare within the city an inoperable vehicle as the same is herein defined for a period of longer than twentyfour hours b from and after the effective date of the ordinance codified in this chapter it is unlawful for any person being the owner of lessee of renter or in custody of any inoperable vehicle to permit the same to remain upon private property within the city for a period of more than thirty days after such owner lessee renter or custodian of the private property has been notified to remove the same such act is prohibited whether the inoperable vehicle is stored or parked upon private property belonging to the owner lessee renter or custodian of such inoperable vehicle or upon private premises belonging to another person firm or corporation c from and after the effective date of the ordinance codified in this chapter it is unlawful for the owner lessee renter or person in charge of any private property within the city to suffer or permit the storing keeping or standing of any inoperable vehicle upon such private property for a period of more than thirty days after the notice is given in the form and manner as set forth in this chapter whether the inoperable vehicle is the property of such owner or not d it shall be prohibited to store any car on any private residential property even though said vehicle is operable it shall be prima facie evidence that a car is being stored on private property if the vehicle does not have a current colorado license plate e it shall be prohibited to store any car on any street within this city even though said vehicle is operable it shall be prima facie evidence that a vehicle is being stored on the street if the vehicle does not have a current colorado license plate upon fortyeight hours notification in writing that the vehicle is in violation of this section the car will be towed and stored at the owners expense     part exclusions and permits a this chapter shall not apply to a vehicle in an enclosed building  to vehicles being stored by a business enterprise as long as the storage of the vehicle is on the same premises where the business is being conducted  or a vehicle being stored by any law enforcement agency in a storage place kept for that purpose b this chapter shall not apply to the storage of a vehicle or parts thereof on private property provided such vehicle and parts of cars and the outdoor storage areas are maintained in such a manner that they do not constitute a health hazard a safety hazard or a fire hazard and are effectively screened from ordinary public view by means of a permanent fence such storage area shall be kept free of weeds trash and other objectionable items c permits if a notice of noncompliance has been given as set forth herein the vehicle owner may apply to the chief of police or his designee for a one time nonrenewable permit to extend the period to achieve compliance for an additional sixty days if 1 there is an ongoing dispute over insurance coverage as to a wrecked or damaged vehicle which has not been totally destroyed by the wreck or accident  2 the owner is doing vehicle repairs which can reasonably be completed within the sixtyday period such permit shall clearly state that it is nonrenewable set forth the penalties for noncompliance and the other remedies available to the city if compliance is not achieved by the owner by the fiftieth day the city shall provide written notice that if such compliance is not achieved by the date that ends the compliance period the city will commence legal proceedings including but not limited to filing a misdemeanor complaint in the municipal court there shall be no charge for the permit the issuance of the permit herein shall not be unreasonably withheld    noticeform and contents a the notice to be given to the owner of such vehicle and the owner of the private premises upon which the same is stored or kept shall be in such form as shall be prescribed by the city manager but such notice shall provide at least the name of the reputed owner a description of the inoperable vehicle the description of the premises upon which the same is stored or kept and a demand that the same is removed no later than thirty days following the date of such notice b in the event the owner of the private property upon which vehicle is stored or kept is also the owner of the inoperable vehicle only one notice shall be sent c all notices shall be sent by first class mail and shall be mailed to the address of such person if such address is known or to the address of such person as reflected by the records of the county clerk and recorder of the county or the county assessor of the county   part posting of notice in the event the letter is returned by the post office unclaimed or for any reason undeliverable then a copy of the notice shall be posted in the city clerks office on a bulletin board to be kept by the city clerk for that purpose and upon the inoperable vehicle in question the notice is to be posted for a period of thirty consecutive days    right of removal a in the event the owner of the motor vehicle or the owner lessee tenant or person in charge of the personal property upon which the same is stored does not remove the offending vehicle within thirty days after date of mailing of the notice or within thirty days from date of posting of the notice as provided in this chapter the city manager or his representative shall have the right to go upon the private premises and to remove the offending vehicle and to impound the same for a period of thirty days from and after the date of such removal b any police officer of the city shall have the right to remove or cause to be removed any inoperable vehicle left on a public street alley or thoroughfare after the same has been left thereon for more than twentyfour hours    right to reclaim for a period of thirty days following the impounding of the vehicle the owner thereof may reclaim the vehicle by paying to the city all costs involved in the removal and storage of the motor vehicle  provided that the vehicle so reclaimed may not thereafter be stored at any place within the city in violation of this chapter in the event a summons and complaint has been issued by the municipal court of the city and the owner thereof or the owner of private property upon which the same was stored shall be convicted for violation of this chapter then prior to the reclamation of said vehicle by the owner such fine imposed by the court shall be first paid  disposition of unclaimed vehicle after the passage of thirty days from date of impoundment and if the vehicle is not reclaimed by the owner as provided in this chapter the owner of the vehicle if known shall be notified by registered mail return receipt requested that the vehicle shall be disposed of by either public or private sale on a date certain the internal administration and procedures of the entire private or public sale process shall conform with the applicable subsections of colorado revised statutes  4241103  violationpenalty in addition to the requires  child a person who has reached the age of ten years and is under eighteen years of age at the time of the alleged offense parent either a natural parent of a child as may be established pursuant to article vi of title 19 of the colorado revised statutes 197 as amended or a parent by adoption part duty of parentappearance in court a whenever a summons and complaint under this filed against a child the court shall send a parent or guardian by first class mail a notice that includes the alleged violation date of violation location at which the alleged violation occurred and the date time and place of the scheduled court appearance and an order that the parent or guardian appear with the minor at each and every court appearance b it shall be the duty of a parent or guardian to appear with the child at each and every court appearance it shall be unlawful for a parent to fail to appear at each and every required court appearance or fail to comply with the written promise to appear with the child and a violation of the same may be punished by a fine not to exceed three hundred dollars andor not more than ninety days in jail it shall be an affirmative defense to this violation if the parent demonstrates to the court that at the time of the offense either 1 the parents did not have lawful custody of the minor  2 the minor was not residing with the parents  3 the minor was emancipated or 4 if the parents can demonstrate that the juvenile was uncontrollable part responsibility of parents for payment of fine a whenever a minor under the age of eighteen years of age residing or living with hisher parents is convicted of an offense under this which the court imposes a fine restitution or court fees or costs the parent of the minor child shall be jointly responsible of payment for such fine restitution or court fees or costs it shall be an affirmative defense to the obligation created by this section if the parents demonstrate to the court that at the time of the offense either 1 the parents did not have lawful custody of the minor  2 the minor was not residing with the parents  3 the minor was emancipated or 4 if the parents can demonstrate that the juvenile was uncontrollable b for the purposes of this section only an emancipated minor means a minor over fifteen years of age and under eighteen years of age who has with real or apparent assent of hisher parents demonstrated hisher independence from hisher parents in the matter of care custody and earnings the term may include but shall not be limited to any such minor who has the sole responsibility for hisher own support who is married or who is in the military failure to pay any courtordered fine restitution or court fees or costs shall be subject to the contempt powers of the city municipal court part appointment of counsel if a child has been brought before the court for an offense of the municipal for an adult is punishable by a jail sentence  a the child or hisher parents may request an attorney and if the child or parents fail to have sufficient financial means counsel shall be appointed by the court  or b the court may appoint counsel without such request if it deems representation by counsel is necessary to protect the interest of the child or other parties part hearing procedures the general public shall not be excluded unless the court makes a specific finding that it is in the best interest of the child to exclude the general public and in such event the court shall admit only such persons who have an interest in the case or the work of the court including persons who the parents wish to have present hearings may be continued from time to time as ordered by the court part  issue of summons complaint and custody a member of the cortez police department shall be empowered to issue a summons and complaint to a child for any violation of this in the opinion of the officer the issuance of the summons and complaint is not adequate to ensure that a child will answer charges under this the officer finds it necessary to take the child into custody the childs custody shall conform to applicable state statutes part juvenile warrant a any arrest warrant issued by the municipal court for a child shall bear a conspicuous notation that the arrestee is a child and the provisions of the applicable state statutes must be observed in the execution of the warrant b whenever a child is arrested the arresting officer shall notify the parents without unnecessary delay such notification may be made to a person with whom the child is residing if the parent guardian or legal custodian cannot be located part incarceration of child a no jail sentence shall be imposed upon persons under the age of eighteen years who have been convicted of a violation under this b incarceration not to exceed fortyeight hours may be imposed on a child for failure to comply with a lawful order of the court including an order to pay a fine any incarceration of a child shall be in compliance with section 1922044 crs part 1993 juvenile sentencing upon the conviction of a violation of the cortez city juvenile as defined herein shall be subject to the penalties as set forth in cortez city a and may also be ordered at sentencing to perform community service as a condition of any suspended sentence any costs imposed to perform community service shall be the responsibility of the juvenile andor his parents and included in the fines and costs assessed by the court at sentencing  92512 editors note  adopted  repealed the former  18b9 parks and recreation establishment and duties of parks and recreation department there is hereby established the parks and recreation department of the city the parks and recreation department shall have the management control and supervision of all facilities public parks fields tracts and areas of the city used for recreation purposes both within and without its corporate limits as well as the center parkings in the streets and avenues and such other areas as may be designated from time to time by the council and shall administer all recreation programs sponsored by the city a parks and recreation director shall be appointed by the city manager and shall have the duty to administer the parks and recreation department as established the parks and recreation director may appoint one or more authorized representatives to administer any part of the duties of this chapter both the director of parks and recreation and his authorized representatives shall be hereinafter referred to as director for the purposes of this chapter the parks and recreation department shall hereinafter be referred to as department park or parks as used in this chapter means all athletic fields parks playgrounds tracts recreational facilities and areas of the city administered or regulated by the city and used for recreational purposes these areas include the city pool the golf course all picnic areas tennis courts athletic fields used for softball baseball soccer or other sports now owned or hereafter acquired  part generallyparks and recreation areas a presence in parks parks will be open daily from  am to  pm the director may extend the closing time to  midnight for such parks playgrounds and athletic areas equipped with general athletic lighting the director may also specify exceptions for specific parks from the abovescheduled open and closing times if open and closing times for a specific park athletic field playground etc are different than the times above specified the applicable open and closed times for that particular park athletic field or playground shall be prominently posted at that particular park athletic field or playground location law enforcement personnel emergency service personnel authorized municipal employees and security personnel employed for special functions are exempt from the provisions of this section loitering in the park between the hours of  pm and  am for the purpose of consuming alcohol purchasing or selling narcotics the use of narcotics or disturbing the peace is prohibited b riding vehicles on grounds of municipal parks etc no person shall at any time drive or ride any automobile truck motorcycle motor scooter or other motor vehicle upon the grounds of any municipal park playground or golf course except in public streets running premises or within designated parking areas or sidewalks located upon such premises without the express written permission of the director c swimming wading and boating in parks boating allowed at denny lake park and geer natural area no person shall swim wade or operate a boat upon any lake lagoon or other water facilities located in any city park or other areas under the supervision of the department without the express written permission of the director nonmotorized boats are permitted at denny lake park and geer natural area d damaging tampering with etc facilities no person shall damage or wastefully or improperly use toilet water and sewer facilities in any municipal park or cause the lighting facilities or electrical appliances to be turned on or used without appropriate fees andor reservation or the express written permission of the director the city may charge fees for athletic lighting to be determined on an annual basis e golfing in parks and on cityowned property no person shall use any portions of any city park or cityowned property for golfing purposes or make use of any golf club or golf ball in any city park or on cityowned property except at places designated for golfing by the director f public meetings in parks it is unlawful to hold any public meetings addressed by one or more speakers and attended by twentyfive or more persons within the parks of the city unless and until a permit therefore pursuant to section 197 of this chapter has been issued by the director such meetings shall be conducted in an orderly and lawabiding manner g intoxicating beverages no person shall have in their possession nor will any person consume any form of alcoholic beverage within the parks of the city except as provided in this chapter for the golf course and authorized special events h loud noises disturbances prohibited no person or persons shall play any radio tape players band or musical instrument television phonograph tape recorder or other device capable of reproducing sound at such a high volume in any municipal park or recreation area as to disturb the peace and quiet of another there shall be no loud or band music or excessive noise beyond  pm or before  am without the express written consent of the director i animals in parks dogs and cats must be on a leash at all times except when participating in obedience classes or other activities authorized by the director horses shall use only bridle paths designated by posted notices no other animals shall be allowed on the grounds of parks playground or golf courses without the express written consent of the director j overnight camping no person or group of persons shall be allowed to camp overnight on any park grounds or parking areas without the express written consent of the director k garbage and trash no person shall dump spill deposit place throw or leave refuse rubbish filthy or odorcausing objects substances or other trash upon any municipal park grounds except in identified trash receptacles l sales advertising in parks and recreation areas 1 sales displays prohibited it is unlawful for any person in a park or recreation area to expose or offer for sale any article substance or thing legal or illegal or to station or place any stand cart or vehicle for the transportation sale of display of any such article substance or thing except any regularly licensed concessionaire acting by and under the written authority of the director or a concession agreement executed by the city and any nonprofit or charitable organization acting under the written authority of the director 2 advertising prohibited it is unlawful for any person in a park or recreation area to announce advertise or call the publics attention in any way to an article or service for sale or hire except any regularly licensed concessionaire acting by and under the written authority of the director or a concession agreement executed by the city  and any nonprofit or charitable organization acting under the written authority of the director 3 sale or offering of personal services is prohibited it is unlawful for any person in a park or recreation course  3 nine holes may be closed for maintenance purposes for a short period of time at the discretion of the golf course superintendent  4 the opening and closing of the golf course will be decided by the golf course professional and the golf course superintendent the director will make the final decision if the golf course professional and the superintendent are in disagreement b golf professional the golf professional pro is the authority for the general management operation and improvement of the golf pro shop during the term of their contract the city shall employ a golf course qualifications and terms of members there is created a golf advisory board for the city consisting of five voting members one member of which shall be a city council person three members of which shall be residents of either cortez or montezuma county and one member shall be a high school youth and shall be appointed by the city council in the following manner and for the following terms a the the mens golf association board who shall be a member of that association from either cortez or montezuma county and will serve for one year  and one member to be nominated by the womens golf the term of each member expires the vacancy thus created shall be filled by a majority vote of the council for a term equal to the position being vacated if a vacancy occurs other than by expiration of term the council by a majority vote shall appoint a new member to fill the unexpired term b the four remaining members of the advisory board shall be ex officio members without vote and shall consist of the mayor of the city the director who shall serve as secretary of the board the golf pro and the golf course superintendent 2 absence from meetings should a member be absent for three consecutive regular meetings of such advisory board without cause the office of such member shall be deemed to be vacant and the term of such member terminated and the secretary of the advisory board shall immediately inform the city council of such termination an absence due to illness or an unavoidable absence from the city and notice thereof to the secretary of the advisory board on or before the day of any regular meeting by such advisory board shall be deemed absence for cause a regular meeting as provided for by law or rule of the advisory board or any regularly advertised public hearing shall be deemed a regular meeting 3 election and term of chairperson  creation and filling of other offices the advisory board shall elect its chairperson from among the appointed members and shall create and fill such other of its offices as it may determine the term of the chairperson shall be one year with the eligibility for reelection the position of chairperson shall be filled at the first regular meeting of each year 4 regular meetings  calling of special meetings the advisory board shall hold at least one regular meeting in each month during the months of march of each year and such special meetings as are necessary in the opinion of the chairperson  provided that a special meeting may be called by any three members of the advisory board or the city manager andor the director upon due notice to the chairperson and the other members of the advisory board 5 adoption of procedural rules  records the advisory board shall adopt rules for transaction of business and plans in voting upon the recommendation of any plan or any part thereof or any amendment extension or addition by resolution of the advisory board the same must be carried by the affirmative vote of a below 1 stay thirty feet from the greens 2 do not drive over tees 3 drive around the outside of all golf trail signs 4 do not drive rental carts at slow speed constantly as it will drain battery dead after nine holes 5 apply brakes evenly and smoothly so turf will not be torn 6 stay out of bunkers and traps keep all carts out of the tall bumpy and rough areas do not drive over ditches except at regulations pertaining to the usage of their private cart 10 one of the two registered owners must be in the private cart for each round of golf played occupancy is limited to that person and one other 11 private cart owners must sign in at the pro shop prior to the playing of any hole at the golf course 12 fees for private cart registration will be set annually by resolution of the council
